Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Rumrunner68
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice with the staff being very qualified and accommodating. The only concern was that it was a bit noisy with people walking by and talking on their cell phones or just talking to each other. Room was very well appointed and the location is excellent. Would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Cute, quaint hotel Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Jenny Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Napa River Inn two times. The first time (November 2011)our room was in the "Plaza" building and our room had a nice view of the river. The room was kind of plain but it was fine. The second time (April 2012) we stayed in the main "Historical" building. The room in the H building was very nice. It had a gorgeous spacious layout, hardwood floors, a very nice king size bed, a fireplace, a claw tub and a huge walk-in shower big enough for two people. My only complaint with the historical room was the noise. The walls were very thin and unfortunately we could hear our neighbors in room 204...the bed was squeaking if you know what I mean! 2 nights in a row we had to knock on the bathroom wall. We could also hear cars and trucks driving by from our little window. Otherwise the hotel is very nice and the people at the front desk were always nice and accommodating. The location is great because you can walk to many places close by to eat and to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Peter F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our first trip to Napa and we stayed at the Napa River Inn. We loved it and would highly recommend it. The location was perfect and the room and view were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming view of the Napa River”
Reviews.Author: momstephano
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week, with our Son and dog. We love the family feel of this hotel, and the rooms are very warm and homey, yet have that upgraded feel. The location is great as it is right in the center of town, within walking distance of all the restaurants and shops. We brought our son for his 21st birthday and we did a Segway Napa tour the day we arrived, and then we did the Napa Wine Train on Thursday. The gourmet lunch on the train is excellent and he enjoyed both activities very much. We really enjoy Napa and the Napa River Inn, is part of the reason. The restaurant Celadon at the hotel is a great fine dining experience, and the grounds around this hotel are beautifully kept,The river walk up to the park is a nice stroll for the dog and owners. I would not even consider staying anywhere else in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the room location”
Reviews.Author: nicolj
Reviews.Content: This hotels consists of 3 buildings, the main historic building has a limited number of rooms. Our first room was on the ground floor in one of two annexe buildings. It was right next to a public path and was very gloomy so we asked to be moved. We picked this hotel for it's river location and we paid the extra for a river view, the first room did had a river view but the issue was a permanent thick net curtain was required for privacy because of the foot path. The only other room available had a view of the car park. On our second night we were moved into the main building and a historic room. It was better but by this point we were pretty fed up. This hotel did not live up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: CA-JustUs
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to escape for the weekend. Great location, terrific staff and amenities. It's only 1.5 hours from home but we felt like we had truly gotten away. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location but noisy and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: micmackid
Reviews.Content: The service and staff at the Napa River Inn were friendly and helpful. The location could not be beat. You can walk everywhere from this hotel, right on the river, which we did. The parking is free in front of the hotel and the breakfast was included but it is from a bakery and mostly sweet pastries with no substance for a good breakfast. The food was never hot. We ended up eating breakfast out one day. The hotel is very old so the walls and floors are very thin and we were woken up early every morning by an upstairs room walking back and forth and we could hear voices and tv next door. The shower was inadequate pressure so it took a while but was ok. The room was very nice, however, and that made up for a bit. The spa services were just massages, no gym or pool but was ok. Due to the noisy rooms and inadequate, high carb only breakfasts, we would not stay here again for the dollar value. Only the location was the best feature. Ps. we did a limo wine tour with Beau tours thru the hotel website and would also not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Dick M
Reviews.Content: Bought the night on a Living Social offer. But would go back at retail, no question about it! Great room, with balcony, great bed, fireplace, and big bathroom. Fabulous location---walking distance to all that matters.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place.”
Reviews.Author: Bridget C
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were only there for one night. The rooms were beautiful, service was excellent and the location great. My only regret is that we could not spend more time there. I look forward to another trip back to The Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 2 nights, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: The service of the staff at the Napa River Inn was friendly and helpful. There was no offer to assist with our bags to the room. Upon entering our room on the ground floor in the adjacent room, we could hear loud noise coming from the room above on the 2nd floor. We requested to be moved before unpacking, which was accommodated by the friendly staff. The Executive Room no: 226, was above the open courtyard for outdoor dining and this was adjacent the "silos" where we later heard music which fortunately finished prior to going to bed. The room had a king size bed, desk, 2 chairs & round table with large flat screen tv in the cabinet. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were too soft for our liking. The bathroom was adequate with a shower over the bath, vanity & toilet. The shower head was one of the worst we had used, the spray was powerful with little water coming out making you dance around to get wet. The breakfast was included and delivered to your room which was supplied by Sweeties Bakery, the food was good and hot. Car parking was available in front of the hotel free of charge. Overall the Napa River Inn was ok for our 2 night stay, but the noise transfer possible through the floors and walls could disturb your stay. We cannot comment on the room in the main building, our room was in the River Plaza Building. If were to return to the Napa Valley area, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite staycation”
Reviews.Author: Jon D
Reviews.Content: We live in Sonoma but love to spend the night at the Napa River Inn and eat at one of the great restaurants and catch a show at the Napa Valley Opera house or Uptown theater. The hotel is perfect. Great in-room breakfast from Sweeties and a simply wonderful bed. Plus it's an easy drive home

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, yet again!”
Reviews.Author: Patty S
Reviews.Content: We just love Napa River Inn. Excellent service, beautiful rooms, great location, all the amenites you need in Napa, soft sheets, robes, fireplace in the room, the list goes on and on. Such a special place and a plus to have Sweetie Pies delicious bakery downstairs. Thank you for a magical stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LisaandMike8-81
Reviews.Content: Our second visit and everything was great again. The front desk supervisor was personable and helpful. The rooms are a bit small but the beds are cozy and comfortable. Easy location for walking to many restaurants. Would recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!! BOOK IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vtreview
Reviews.Content: Super cute historic building. I was planning a birthday party for my friend with three couples. The hotel called to make sure our rooms and dinner reservation were perfect....and they were! Very impressive customer service and staff. We booked the dining package that includes $100 resturant credit (we chose Morimoto...pricey but wonderful), breakfast in bed was yummy, beds comfy, rooms charming and clean, location convenient... What more can I say? Do it!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Harper0308
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on all the positive Trip Advisor reviews and find ourselves here and extremely disappointed. The only thing it has going for it is the downtown location -- but if you walk just a few more blocks you can stay at a MUCH better property for the price. The room is Motel 6-level quality -- every time we take a step, the entire room shakes. Fortunately, we are on the top floor, but I can't imagine the consternation our steps are causing the people on the floor below us. The decor is 1970s tacky -- significantly below what we would expect for a hotel in this price range with such high ratings. We are only here for one night and we arrived late in the evening, so we are living with it, but if we had multiple nights, I would have checked out immediately and asked for a refund just upon seeing the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - quiet corner.”
Reviews.Author: VinemontCarl
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We were in the building that is separate from the main lobby building. The room was very nice and very clean. The hotel is in a quiet corner away from everything, but within walking distance of the main street in Napa. Not sure if this hotel is part of the Napa Mill, but we ate at one of the restaurants and it, too, was good. Tried to buy some wine at the wine tasting area in the general store, but the guy behind the counter insisted that we tried any wine before we bought it. He would not let us go until we were happy with our selection. If was funny and we enjoyed ourselves. When (if?) we go back to Napa we'd likely stay at the Napa River Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “19th century charm with a touch of modern in beautiful downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Sean D
Reviews.Content: Any traveler that has been to the Napa Valley at least once knows that it's chalked full of history and that's a big part of the charm of downtown Napa and the city preservationists have clearly made a point to ensure that it stays that way. The Napa River Inn is a gem. When you first walk into the lobby you get a sense that you have just stepped back in time to the late 19th century but without feeling that the surroundings are dated. Within your beautiful and well-appointed guest room you'll enjoy all the modern conveniences including wireless internet access, flat panel TV, CD clock radio with an Ipod docking station and more. The lobby, the guestroom hallways and the rooms themselves have been carefully designed in the original Victorian-esqe style of the inn but with a sense of newness. The hallway walls display period sepia-tone pictures of Napa's bygone era including one of Capt. Hatt who established the adjacent Napa Mill in the 1880's. My wife and I enjoyed the convenience of dining at Celadon, located just around the corner from the Inn, and a walking to Morimoto's to enjoy martinis. Thank you to the warm and welcoming staff of the Napa River Inn, we loved our stay and we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “We liked the place”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: We had not pre-booked this hotel and picked it by pure luck. The location is great, the room was fairly large, the beds comfy and the breakfast, that was served in the room, was very good. What more can you ask for? Being in the downtown of Napa, next to the river, our room was also quiet. Parking could be a problem as the hotel does not have private parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl14
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking this as it was a Groupon. But our experience was delightful. Nice spacious room and bathroom, very clean, lots of towels. The staff was always accomodating and helpful. Breakfast in the room a great plus. I would return to the Napa River Inn, but unfortunately, not the town of Napa. Not much to do or see, other Napa valley towns much more charming. Great restaurants though.

Reviews.Title: “NAPA getaway”
Reviews.Author: zimalane127
Reviews.Content: Nice place to be, has a lot to offer. I really like how everything was a walking distance to restaurant, spa, bakery and stores. Crystal at front desk was very helpful/attentive. Getting breakfast delivered to our room from Sweet Pie bakery was a plus. Had dinner at Angele and food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn with Great deals”
Reviews.Author: dla911
Reviews.Content: January in Napa is chilly but not at the Napa River Inn. Fisrt class rooms plus great dining deals--try $100 gift certificates to Napa's best restaurants with every room nite, including Morimoto.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Trip at Napa River Inn”
Reviews.Author: catan12
Reviews.Content: We bought a great package through Living Social. The staff at Napa River Inn made this birthday trip an exceptional one. The hotel is in a wonderful location and allows visitors to easily walk around downtown comfortably. The staff was very accommodating and the Concierge, Laurie, was extremely helpful. We would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay IN napa”
Reviews.Author: NBere
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn has a great location and the rooms are lovely. We stayed there just one night, but loved the warm fire in the lobby, the keurig coffee makers and robes in the room (standard room) and breakfast delivered free to your room. The locale is a little different with the rooms wrapping around a corner block amidst restaurants, coffee shops, and a general store, but it made for an easy way to grab dinner in the evening-just a short 3 minute walk and walk. The hotel sits right on the river, so after our breakfast was deliverd, we walked out to the patio area and sat at a nice little table and enjoyed breakfast overlooking the river. Overall, a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: bschoolbound
Reviews.Content: My husband and I struggled to find the perfect succinct description of the Napa River Inn, and we agreed on "elegantly cozy". I wouldn't call it "luxury", per se, but it is utterly fabulous even at full-price. Pros: INCREDIBLE location right on the river and walkable to so many things Wonderful staff (especially Krystal at the front desk) Adorable little "pet welcome package" Marble bathrooms Great included-breakfast Lovely fireplace and balcony Terrific partnerships (read: discounts and nice little "freebies") with fabulous local shops/restaurants Overall, the atmosphere is SO relaxing!!! A GREAT weekend trip from SF. Cons: The partnership with the spa in the parking lot - La Pelle. They have a terribly rude staff, and are very over-priced for the non-existent atmosphere and mediocre massage. TOTALLY not worth the price and dealing with the rude staff. This is VERY minor, but no room service. You don't have to walk far AT ALL for delicious food, but sometimes you just want to lay by the fire in your bath robes and eat pizza. :)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Napa getaway”
Reviews.Author: lizzymv
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite place to stay in Napa, because it's literally in the city of Napa, along the river. You can walk out the door and in to the city which has boomed in the last few years with restaurants and bars. The staff is so friendly, dogs are welcome, and the rooms are comfy with great beds. Breakfast is included at Sweetie Pies next door where they have the best pastries and breakfast quiches or sandwiches. They will deliver to your door or mosy down in the morning and relax with a coffee and paper. Frankly I shouldn't be writing this because I thinks it's a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great sleep”
Reviews.Author: loprof
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Napa River Inn with another couple. Both of us had received promotions to stay -- dinner credits at one of their restaurants, wine tasting coupons, breakfast in bed, etc. Pros -- the hotel was in a great location. It's within walking distance to everything in downtown Napa. We walked to dinner and a couple tasting rooms and were pleased that we didn't have to use our car to get around. The hotel itself was also pretty cute. Our room was well set up and even had a fireplace, which was lovely. Cons -- the hotel had to have some of the thinnest walls and floors/ceilings I've ever encountered. My husband and I could not sleep at all because the people above us were walking around their room all night. We also heard plenty of noise from the road nearby. The couple we visited with had a similar problem. Their room overlooked the courtyard area and there were people going in and out and chatting all night. None of us got any sleep. In the end, my husband and I left really early in the morning so that we could take a bit of a nap in our own bed. I would never return, or recommend this place to friends. Perhaps you have to be really, really drunk to sleep here...

Reviews.Title: “Great spot --”
Reviews.Author: bigmarley4
Reviews.Content: *I am basing my review on a Travelzoo certificate I purchased for 50% off from a friend who couldn't go -- not based on value of paying the rack rate.* Great location right on the Napa River, with excellent, large rooms. Ours had a fireplace and balcony on the river side, which was amazing. Service was excellent -- very helpful without nagging us constantly. I would recommend it for others if you can get a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic inn!”
Reviews.Author: rboydinlb
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend done time in the wine country and found this gem on Living Social. Great location that was in walking distance to places to eat and shopping... Also a movie theater! The room was beautiful! The fireplace cozy and the service .. Perfect! We had a great time..!

Reviews.Title: “Great location outstanding service, Looking forward to coming back for another getaway evening soon”
Reviews.Author: Dudleyca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located to great dining, shopping, nightlife and the friendly staff made this hotel a definite 5 star. This hotel is definitley a place I will be coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, rejuvenated downtown, but inn disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lwolff1
Reviews.Content: We were really excited about the opportunity to spend a wine tasting weekend in the Napa area and chose the Napa River Inn for its convenience and enticing website pictures. We were greeted by a friendly staff but unfortunately things went downhill from there. The rooms are much smaller than they appear although we had a higher end one. It was decorated nicely but felt a bit cramped. It had a little deck for viewing the river, which unfortunately was very low and not too scenic. What surprised us most were the paper thin walls! We could hear the conversations next door and the walking above us sounded like a herd of elephants. We felt like we were in a funky motel! In addition, the bathroom/closet was poorly thought out. The closet was literally in the bathroom sink area, with no door dividing that from the toilet and shower. We're not a modest couple, but it felt awkward and cramped. That day they put up holiday lights all around the outside and they were very bright white ones that did not go off during the night, even when we complained. It felt like we were very disconnected from the front desk and staff, both literally and figuratively! The breakfast was good but mainly starchy choices. The best part about our stay was the terrific restaurant Celedon right downstairs. A must even if you're staying elsewhere. Sadly we would not return, although seeing the revival of downtown Napa was worth the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy room with high-end ammenities”
Reviews.Author: fool4travel
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious but still felt cozy and luxurious. The breakfast basket that is brought to your room is scrumptious. The breakfast sandwich was rather greasy, but tasty, and much needed for my mild wine-tasting hangover. And the morning bun is truly PHENOMENAL!! From reading other posts, I think it is important to pay that extra money for the upgraded rooms, because I just have not one bad thing to say about this place. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale historic Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kelley O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch, but what I enjoyed the most was its location to downtown Napa (which isn't very big but a lot of fun to walk around) and it's wine country historic feel. The balcony's are too small to actually use, but the flowers and vines covering it are a nice touch. The bathroom is large and the room is comfortable and roomy. There is free parking too! (It's an outdoor lot that can fill up at certain times though.) The people were very nice and there are excellent shops right next door including Cutie Pies for breakfast or any time you want a pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, overrated a little bit...”
Reviews.Author: mzjablonski85
Reviews.Content: I went to the Napa River Inn on a Livingsocial deal as a romantic getaway with my girlfriend. The pictures on the website are definitely a little bit Photoshopped- as the 'river' is really a wash with a loud freeway on the otherside. I was a little dissapointed when I went out on our balcony and heard and saw all the freeway noise. I think the walls are a little thin in the room- as we could hear the people in the room next to us talking and their TV blaring. However, the room amenities were very nice. Flat screen TV, fireplace, and a bottle of wine upon our entry. Bed was very comfortable and everything was clean.There were a lot of restaurants and shoppes within walking distance which was very nice, and a romantic promenade along the 'river'. Overall- it was a good deal on Livingsocial, but I don't know if I would pay the full room rate because it was not quite a 4-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: familyPalmer
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, The room big and beautifully decorated with the nicest ensuite I have seen to date, it has a roll top bath and very nice shower, soft towelling dressing robes - if you want something special and to fell pampered, this is a great hotel. Napa is a good location but as a destination I preferred Sonoma a few miles away - it has much more character than Napa we thought.

Reviews.Title: “TOO HYPED UP”
Reviews.Author: ninice27
Reviews.Content: I thought from the pictures I show that this would be a terrific Hotel, and there were certainly favorible aspects to staying here, as the front desk help was very nice, especially Krystal. What did disapoint me, was that I made the reservations through Jetsetters, and what I was showed in the pictures and what was written about my accomadations, was not honered when I walked in through the door. I finally showed them the email and website to show them what I paid for, and the still had to call Jetsetters and told me that I may be charged extra, becuase what was written was a mistake. I have never heard of such thing. It is not my fault it was printed there. They should honor THEIR mistakes, and not try to point the blame or pin the blame on me!! I was very offended!! Then I had to ask for the FREE bottle of wine that was offered and all the gift certificates. Finally we got to the room, and it was not the room that was explained in the offer, and I had to call, once again to the front desk. They switched our room, no problem... But i just felt that the customer service was lacking. With the misunderstanding that happpened, I thought they should be more appologetic and helpful. They should have walked the walk, and not just talked the talk, as far as an appology goes. I definately would not stay here again. Even w. the discount i paid $307/night, and I did not feel that it was worth it. Too many other cute places to stay in Napa like the Candle light inn or Embassy hotel... or better yet, cute little b&b's.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, no working internet”
Reviews.Author: joshuatarr
Reviews.Content: Everything about the property was exceptional, except the lack of internet. We were planning on skyping with the kids and planning our trip using the internet but needed to hang out in starbucks instead...

Reviews.Title: “Executive room it is not!”
Reviews.Author: LemonCracker
Reviews.Content: Granted we got a decent deal from groupon, but do expect Executive room to look more spacious. Room and bathroom both very small. 2 small windows overlooking public patio and a glimpse of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded with Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: kmg61
Reviews.Content: One of the most enjoyable stays we've had anywhere with some of the best food we've ever experienced. My husband & I went for a birthday get away. Heather set us up in a room with a balcony overlooking the river and patio which had a fountain and palm trees. The most delicious surprise of truffles were waiting for us when we arrived with a card from Heather wishing us a Happy Birthday. Thank you, Heather! We selected a few items for our complimentary breakfast brought up to our room the next morning at the time of our choosing. The AM Bun was a new delight with the fluffiest, tastiest quiche ever. The most delicious variety of gourmet food was just a few steps away. It felt safe walking all over town in the evening with plenty of places to stimulate our interest. Sweets, live music, shopping, bicycle rentals, you name it! We also strolled through town along the river. I came home with some beautiful earrings from the General Store and a pair from the gift shop at the Napa River Inn to remember a wonderful experience. Loved it loved it loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to walk around and not drive”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here, planned on driving around to wineries but ended up walking around eating and drinking wine downtown within walking distance from the hotel. Rooms had double beds, a bit small for 2 adults to share but we made it work. Walls are thin and wished there was a hot tub but otherwise, we enjoyed our stay here. The breakfast in the morning was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mary07036
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed with my recent stay at the Napa River Inn. So much so that we checked out 1 night early. It was seriously the smallest, darkest hotel room I've ever been in with the most claustrophobic bathroom ever. It is on a river that includes a view of a highway-did not find anything charming about the area. Not much to the Mill in terms of stores- after 10 minutes of exploring we had seen everything. There are a lot of restaurants nearby-that was the only positive that we could see to actually staying in the city of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: tsainta
Reviews.Content: Very small clean room with a view of a wall for $300. If location is your highest priority, this could be the place. If it isn't, then it isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: mandb_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very comfortable and the location perfect for strolling to all the wine tasting rooms and the Wine Train. We paid extra for a river view balcony room, but there is an ugly highway the other side of the river, so not really worth it. The landscaping around the hotel is well done - obviously they have made a lot of effort. The second night we were a little dissapointed to find that the hotel's Silos Jazz Bar, for which we had been given a complementary wine flight coupon at check in, was closed for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila S
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Social Living. The staff was incredible, the property beautiful, and a great location on the river. You can walk everywhere, and it is surrounded by great restaurants. Our favorite was Angeles, next door. Pablo was our waiter. He was wonderful and Monty , the Manager, was also great. I would not recommend Fish Story Restaurant. We were treated poorly by our waiter, Rob, and would not go back, We will be returning to the Napa River Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: rohanluktuke
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable nice hotel located at the bottom of Main St. in downtown Napa. We got a deal for this hotel through jetsetter. The room was very nice and clean. They have a very traditional decor in the rooms. Bathrooms have brass trimmings and the shower had 2 shower heads! Nice bath products as well. The hotel is located in Downtown Napa. On one side of the hotel is the Napa river. Take a stroll and enjoy the decent views. Its close to many nice restaurants like Zuzu and Ubuntu located on Main st. Wineries however are not very close by. You will have to drive at least 10-15 mins to get to the good wineries. If you look at the map you will see that. There is a nice breakfast/lunch cafe/pastry shop on the property. The staff was very nice and courteous. A nice location if you don't mind driving 10-15 mins to wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: sunshineboltie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is spot on. The river runs behind it and the restaurants are plentiful in the area. We were greeted by a friendly check in clerk and given our room immediately. We chose to be on the second floor because of reviews about noise. The room was sparsely appointed, but had a desk with chair, and another chair to relax in. The bed was super comfy with a down comforter, soft sheets and and down pillows aplenty. A nice Keurig coffee pot was in the room. Breakfast was included from Sweetie Pies and it was great! The only gripe I had, is that the room air conditioner would not go on as low as we would have liked, so the room was quite warm. When we opened our door at night to bring in some cool air, the noise was too great from the restaurant below.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to sites”
Reviews.Author: Mystycka
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Napa River Inn and thoroughly enjoyed our Historic Deluxe room in the Embarcadero Building. The breakfast from Sweetie Pies was a lot more substantial than we'd expected, the room was always well cleaned and we couldn't have asked for more. Location wise, it was perfect. Walking distance to the Wine Train, plus most of the restaurants & wineries we visited were within a half hour's drive. We had some issues with the wi-fi, but when it worked (which was most of the time), it worked very well. Location is great for a morning run, too, as there's much to see in the area. Room includes safe & mini fridge, which were convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: rd55127
Reviews.Content: Nice Napa location with easy access to area wineries but disappointing for physical amenities. Reserved a River view king and got a parking lot view Queen. Site claimed to provide free breakfast delivered to room. Yes and no. Only get free breakfast if booked directly through hotel - otherwise it is $15 per person per day.

Reviews.Title: “Embarcadero room”
Reviews.Author: wzwang128
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice, the room was smaller than I expected. I liked the fact that the room we stayed at was pet friendly and that the free Wifi was convenient. The view was ok. However, the location was great! It's conveniently located next to the newly developed area. The complimentary breakfast was ok. It included croissants from Sweetie Pie. I liked the AM buns... I think that's what they are... cinnamon flavored and surgar coated pastry. Overall experience was ok, just that the room was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a "Mom's Away" week-end!!!”
Reviews.Author: CinKin
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn is within walking distance to many great restaurants and wine-tasting bars. The made-to-order breakfast from Sweetie Pies is a delicious bonus! This has to be the best place to stay in Napa if you are looking for convenient location with the ability to walk around and drink wine!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Liz B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, walkable to tons of restaurants and tasting rooms in downtown Napa. Parking is free and breakfast is included. Rooms are picturesque and offer a bed and breakfast feel. I was worried about noise in the rooms after reading some other Trip Advisor reviews, but we encountered no late night noises, and couldnâ€™t hear a peep from the rooms above (we were on the first floor). Overall an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: quiltingcanuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a collection of buildings beside the Napa River. The location is lovely and historic. It is also mere blocks from the downtown of Napa so it is an easy walk to a wide variety of restaurants if the ones on site do not appeal. We stayed in the Embarcadero building, ground floor, facing the parking lot. Our room was large and very comfortably furnished. It turns out we had the handicap access room, which meant the washroom was huge! Big flat screen tv and wireless computer access were also present. Breakfast was included - we could have had it delivered to our room but chose to meet the rest of our group each morning at Sweetie Pies, the little bakery cafe, where we were provided a huge and delicious breakfast each morning. Sweetie Pies was great preparation for a day of wine touring! There is no onsite fitness facility, but the hotel is on a beautiful pathway that runs north and south, perfect for a run or a walk. There are also bikes for rent for further exploring. We didn't eat at the Angele's or The General Store, the two eateries on site. There is also a nightclub called Silo's - some rooms may be uncomfortably close when there is live music. We would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: baw730
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nites at the Napa River Inn and it was the best vacation ever. Everyone at the Inn went out of their way to make sure we were happy. The breakfast brought to your room every morning was absolutely delicious, my favorite was the AM bun. We had a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking the courtyard and patio and also had a view of the river. The bed was so comfortable. The location is perfect, right in the middle of everything. Our 1st day it was a misty rain, but we enjoyed walking in it to the Bounty Hunter and to Oxbow Public Market. I appreciated Matthew handling all the arrangements for our tours. Heather and Krystal were so helpful everyday. Laurie was so great for helping arrangements to get all my wine glasses shipped home. If we ever go back to Napa, I can assure you that the Napa River Inn will definitely be the place we stay. I've never stayed anywhere that was so accommodating to our needs. The whole staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. You won't find a friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to base your trip to wine country”
Reviews.Author: wizofwas
Reviews.Content: Although the City of Napa is overall not as attractive as the wine country we came to explore, the town has made a great effort to make the downtown area inviting. Along the river at the end of Main St. is the Napa River Inn set in the buildings of an old time mill. From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but the rooms are well appointed and the beds are the most comfortable we encountered on our trip. Parking is provided although you may need to wheel you luggage about a block or so depending on which building your room is located. The staff is friendly and helpful. The included room service breakfast is nice but the same menu every day should you be staying more than a few days, it may get boring. The location is great being very near to great places to eat and only a few blocks away from the main routes into both Napa and Sonoma. One thing we wished we had was a room with a river view, alas we overlooked a tin roof building.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel although a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: RossEasterbrook
Reviews.Content: The Napa River Inn is well situated at the southern end of Napa town and is part of an historic building complex. The rooms were very pleasant and possibly the highest bed that I have ever slept in. The breakfast is very nice - delivered to your room each morning There is plenty of parking and good access to the walking tours (wine involved!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Napa River Inn”
Reviews.Author: JoJo30327
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Napa Valley would not have been such a great experience if it were not for the Napa River Inn. Lovely inn in a great location on the water front. The staff was great and the room was nice. Not the most luxurious hotel room I've stayed in but when you are in Napa you aren't in your room much. Very clean and easy to get in and out of. Parking was very easy. The breakfast service was fantastic b/c you can either get it brought to your room or just walk right around the corner to Sweetie Pies and pick up your complimentary breakfast there. The only downfall if you are going to be spending a lot of time at the wineries in St. Helena and Yountville is that it's about a 20 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Wine Country Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tara999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic find! Encouraged by good online reviews, we chose this inn and couldn't have been more pleased with it. The room was absolutely gorgeous, luxurious and immaculate. The breakfast-in-bed was delicious, and there were lots of choices to be able to try new things every day. The in-room fireplace was particularly nice, even in August - it sometimes gets cool on a summer evening. There are lots of wonderful restaurants within a short walk, and even one with a lovely patio right next to the rooms. I couldn't recommend this place more highly! It was an ideal choice for a romantic getaway. I use trip advisor all the time to choose places to stay, but have never written a review before myself. This place was so outstanding, I just had to write my first review!

Reviews.Title: “Napa River Inn - Ill be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: I will keep it short but specific. One of the best hotels i have ever stayed at, ever! From the first impression upon arriving, incredible warmth and coziness of the room and bed, to the views and breakfast delivery; this was the best stay ever. An all in one concept - hotel, bakery, sweet shop, jazz club - this is a resort with an 'inn' feel. I will ALWAYS go back there. Also, the bathroom was spotless, comfortable, spacious, and the towels are almost 6 feet in length!! I stayed in several nights because it was so comfortable. Worth every penny! Thank you Napa River Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Pamper Yourself--We Did and Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CJ C C
Reviews.Content: We will be returning to this lovely hotel! We chose online due to convenient downtown location and hoped for the best. It was outstanding and more than we expected. It was convenient to walk to wonderful restaurants. Sweetie Pies for our breakfast offered healthy choices and we were able to splurge too! The rooms were comfortable with very luxurious bath and bed. Also, the staff was so friendly and even came around to our room during "happy hour" with ice for the ice bucket!! Wonderful Treat for these travelers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: Woody8991
Reviews.Content: We love this place. From our reservationist through our visit the staff have been great. The Inn was built within the structures of an historic mill. Consequently, the unique rooms seem to vary in size and shape. We have a great room with a balcony overlooking the river and general store. If you are looking for a quiet country setting, you should know that the downtown location does come with a very little bit of downtown type noise. What you get in return is a vibrant downtown experience. Park your car, taste great wines, pick a top shelf restaurant, listen to live music everywhere and walk home to an awesome hotel. How cool is that! If you like unique, well appointed hotels in a great location, the Napa River Inn is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhapoFishShack
Reviews.Content: Nice and Comfortable. We went with a few couples for a Napa weekend. The rooms with views are very small, and the rooms without views were larger. Clean and nicely decorated. Our room was quite large, but was on a noisy street corner and the fireplace did not work. We asked for help with it and no one came. Overall it is a great location in Napa for walking around town and convenient to nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “more than just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovethegoodthings
Reviews.Content: With 2 restuarants, a general store, a delicious bakery and more in the mill complex, this is a great base for exploring Napa Valley. It's easy to find and there's plenty of parking available. Reception displays details of activities in the area, plus there are ipads, complementary coffee and cucumber iced water (delicious!) for guests. As well as our breakfast vouchers we received comlementary drinks vouchers for the club beside the General store where we saw two bands after dinner one evening. Delicious breakfast comes from Sweetie Pies bakery (available in the bakery or via room service) . My friend was hooked on their morning buns in no time. Breakfast is also available in the Napa General Store - we ate there with our pilot and fellow flight mates after our balloon ride with Balloons Above The Valley. We ate at the excellent Angele restaurant at the end of the mill building and it was so good that we booked and returned the next night. There was a problem with our initial room so we were moved to 102 in the Embarcadero. It's a seriously spacious room with an enormous and unbelievably comfortable bed with gorgeous linens. It was the best sleep I had all trip.The CD player with a couple of mellow CDs was a nice touch and it was the only hotel we stayed in where there was a kettle as well as a coffee maker, which i very much appreciated. The only minor irritations that we had were regarding the power sockets which didn't seem to work at all at one side of the room and the bathroom (the shower took a while to get warm and the energy saving light incredibly slow to respond) but neither would put me off staying there again or recommending the hotel. The "very good" rating for value is a reflection of our great satisfaction with room 102 (excellent vaue) tempered by the disappointment and frustration we'd have felt if the initial problem hadn't existed and we'd had to stay in our initial room which was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely "Napa Renaissance" experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelbyrail
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a two-night stay and captured a river view room with balcony which was delightful. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet although on occasion we heard water running from the upper floor but it was not at all an issue. We could watch the Wine Train on the tracks across the river which was an added treat. The breakfasts from Sweetie Pie's were delightful with a nice selection to choose from, and both mornings they were delivered on time by a very friendly and gracious staff member. My only disappointment was with the yogurt parfait which I ordered on the side. The yogurt was standard Greek yogurt and the granola had very little sweetness, making it a rather bland and very tart parfait. But all of our other choices were well prepared and tasty. We were able to walk to the downtown Napa areas where we enjoyed meals at Norman Rose Tavern and Ristorante Allegria. It was nice to feel vitality from some segments of the downtown area as Napa continues to build on their renaissance and restoration. It would be nice to have more shops open, but the lovely wine and craft fair on Saturday was a pure delight! I found several treasures on Saturday and everyone was very pleasant and helpful. Our Wine Train excursion was on Friday with friends, and it was a convenient drive from the Napa River Inn to the train station. Overall, we had a lovely experience and we will certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price- more of a motel”
Reviews.Author: tali71
Reviews.Content: Very noisy so if you are on the first level as I was, you can hear anyone that walks past your window all through the day and night. Should be a different price considering some rooms are much bigger than others. We stayed in rooms 105,106,107 and one of the rooms was much larger than the other two and the other two rooms were very different sizes too but we paid the same for all of them. I had also requested two beds in each room but was told on arrival that there was only one bed in each of the rooms. The rooms are clean and very nice inside but the hotel feeling is one of a motel and the price should be the same. There is also no pool which is a disadvantage in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Judith K
Reviews.Content: First visit to Napa River Inn and it won't be the last.Everything from the lovely room to the great breakfasts,the garden patio with river view and close proximity to shopping made this hotel a 4 star for us.A plus was the accomadating staff esp. Shane,Laurie,Sara and Irene I must add the bed was the most cmfortable we have ever slept in home or away..My husband and I have nothing but wonderful memories of The Napa River Inn. Judy and Pat Keogh Ct.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get closer to the heart of the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: shanghaidoug
Reviews.Content: Finished off a 2,000 mile road trip at Napa River Inn. Breakfast delivered to the door (incuded in price!) and sat on the balcony looking over the river planning our winery tours. Easy to get to and a short drive to some of the best wine tasting anywhere. Then just steps to great selection of places for drinks and dinner. Ask the desk for dinner or winery recommendations. Would certainly come back. again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NCLv2trvl
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I visited Napa this past weekend for my birthday. Check-in was flawless and our king room was located on the third floor/ balcony. If you're looking for a Ritz style room, NRI isn't the hotel for you, but if you're looking for a hotel with average rooms, very comfortable beds (which include lots of fluffy pillows) and an awesome location, this is the place for you. All in all, a lovely hotel that could use a makeover. Perhaps brighter colored paint and new carpet in the rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of history and luxury”
Reviews.Author: LuvTraveling63
Reviews.Content: For those who prefer something other than a cookie cutter modern luxury hotel, the Napa River Inn is the way to go. History surrounds you and can sweep you to a bygone era while you still enjoy all the amenities of modern living. My room overlooked the Napa river and was equipped with a nice flat screen, free wi-fi, a much nicer than average coffee maker, a gas fireplace, and spa robes. The ice bucket was magically filled and the bed turned down as I wandered around the area. I appreciated the fridge with free water and the choice to have fancier bottled water for a small fee. The grounds are lush with blooming vegetation, fine dining is at every turn within walking distance (michelin and zagat rated restaurants), and nightlife is steps away at the jazz club. The spa was heavenly (I recommend the back treatment) and the sweet shop enticed with such delights as chardonnay and port wine truffles. Bicycles are available for free as are bandaids and first aid supplies (don't jog while playing with apps on your cell phone--the river view and people watching can be distracting enough!) Boutique shops abound with little treats for the lucky traveler or friends back home. Breakfast in bed was a nice treat with many options available to please even the pickiest palates. Although originally planned as a couples getaway, conflicting work schedules resulted in a solo trip. I felt perfectly safe and comfortable and would repeat this excursion again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: jaymsea
Reviews.Content: This property was suggested to us by the visitor's center because everything with double beds was booked. It's in a central location, great places to eat are close, it has parking, sweet little breakfast is included, it's clean, and the staff is very pleasant! Our room had a nice little balcony. If you want to stay in town, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing- Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: Golf_Daddy_In_Marco
Reviews.Content: What a huge disappointment! The Napa River Inn Website promised "Luxury... a decadent urban hotel with high style and warmth... World class food... a delightful unique experience." I have a secret for you. Don't waste your money here! Nothing could be farther from the truth. The design of our room was a mess. The A/C unit was positioned 17" from the head of the bed, good luck sleeping in those conditions! In order to use the bathroom, you had to open doors that prevented your spouse from using the sink. The pillows were flat and I suspect purchased on low bid with no regard to quality. The window blinds required multiple efforts just to raise and lower them, one was broken. Lets talk food. They had a nice little bakery that served 4-5 choices for breakfast. The quality of the food was at best very average. My problem was having to ask the staff three days in a row to clear a table so we could sit. I would then have to ask that they also wipe off the table. One saving grace is that the Napa River Inn is located in downtown Napa. Here is my grade for the Napa River Inn: High Style - F World Class Food - F Delightful Unique Experience - F Don't waste your money at the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay when in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: mrmcc209
Reviews.Content: Got a deal through a social media website. I first set up a time to go around my birthday but at the last minute had to change plans. The phone call to the hotel followed and spoke to reservations. They were easy to work with in changing the date and took the offer at the time to upgrade to a larger room with a great view of the river. Since I needed to bring along a four legged furry friend to stay during the visit I called back to the hotel to get some information on Pet Sitters. Spoke to Linda the conceirge who quickly answered my questions about pet sitters. I gave her the information that I was looking for and the budget and she quickly took care of setting up the pet sitter so that a great night out for dinner could be enjoyed. En-route hotel was the trip from hell. Two accidents on the way. One was a major detour as Hiway 12 was closed. I again called the hotel and Linda again took great care to help me rearrange a massage appointment that was pending. I will tell you that the people at Le Pelle Spa were fantastic. Not only did the honor the stay open late to accomidate our late arrival but they honored the whole 90 minute session. Thank you very much to the staff at Le Pelle. Linda also was great in working with us on arranging that late arrival for the massage. I have never seen in all my years going to Napa seen a person go out of her way to help arrange for a late arrival. Check in was great. Heather had everything ready to go and took care of getting someone to help me with my bags to the room. Mathew found me as I was out walking the dog and worked with me while the last bit of business was taken care of. The room #215 was a corner room. Nice view of the river the only knock is the plants growing on the balcony make it hard for two people to sit out on the small patio. Also the doors to the patio need to have a way to keep them open easier. Wedging a chair was not the ideal method to do that. Bathroom was spacious and the separate tub and shower are spacious. The pet sitter went off without a hitch and a short walk up the street to Fish Story was fantastic. The next morning the breakfast arrived at the set time on the dot. The only knock was the coffee was cold. I would think a single carafe of coffee would have been nicer but hey I can not complain about free food showing up in the room on the dot. If you are traveling with a four legged friend the steps that the Inn went through for them was fantastic. The bowls that were there were perfect the spill mat great and the doggie blanket was fantastic. Even the bag of treats was great too. The pet sitter that was set up for by Linda was fantastic. Bekka arrived on time and took great care of our pet for the three hours we were gone. Great job. Lastly check out was smooth and simple. The Inn is close to downtown and some great restaurants. I have nothing to say but great things about this Inn. I will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Flufton
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice. Napa River Inn is located in a recently renovated part of the little town of Napa. A very nice place to stay. Convenient, within walking distance to many really good restaurants. "Angele," and "Celedon" are steps from your hotel room. A two minute walk to "Morimoto's" and "Fish Story" restaurants. Located on the Napa River with lovely views of the river, the wine train etc. There's a really cool nightclub called "Silo's" adjacent to the hotel that had a great cabaret duo performing. Breakfast was included and delivered to your room from a bakery, Sweetie Pie's, on the premises . Very nice quiche and various bear claws, danish etc. A little pricey but a beautiful property with great service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, overpriced Napa.”
Reviews.Author: Indychic
Reviews.Content: Negative experience from beginning with their having the billing messed up creating awkward business situation. The only rooms I've ever seen that small were in Europe. The closet door couldn't be opened without standing on the bed. If you were standing at the vanity you had to move for anoth to exit the bathroom. A huge wall a/c unit was positioned to blow only in the bathroom. The room was over an outdoor restaurant and parking lot so having windows open was not an option. One Roman Shade was inoperable resulting in outside lights shining in the room all night. The carpet was soaking wet in 1/3 of the room. All this for a mere $350/night! Event weekend Napa gouging which may be fine if you are living large but we were working. On a positive note, the staff was professional and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “I always wanted a clawfoot bathtub...now I have one in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: eabjork
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business, but all that faded away the moment I walked into my room. The room was adorable, and the bathroom even better! I never get a chance to just soak in the tub at home, and here I had my very own clawfoot tub. I loved it! Big enough for two (a girl can dream), but more importantly exactly what I needed after a long week. The next morning, all I wanted to do was sleep a few more minutes in comfy bed and dream about spending the day in Napa; I could have stayed in that room for days. However, the smell of fresh baked morning buns from the bakery below does provide some good motivation to venture downstairs. I fell in love with this place and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Great room. Great time.”
Reviews.Author: James V
Reviews.Content: We did the "I left my car in SF" package and were upgraded to the Captain Hatt Suite when we checked in. The staff was wonderful. The property has just about anything you could want from the bakery cafe to the chocolate shop and the excellent Celadon restaurant. The Concierge wrangled us a table at our ideal time after we were first told the restaurant was booked. Have to say the transportation portion of the trip was filled with small aggravations, but that was through the Wine Train operator and should not reflect badly on the hotel. More an advisory for those considering that package.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, we've cancelled your reservation!”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through the hotel and received a confirmation. We showed up at 5pm to check in and was informed that they were overbooked but they would put us up at another hotel about 15 minutes away. No directions to the other hotel and NO call earlier in the day to inform us that the hotel overbooked. We had a 5:30 dinner reservation with a show at 8pm, and now we've got to drive 15 minutes away and back. We only selected this hotel so we wouldn't have to drive. Our first and LAST time at the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but wish it had a pool”
Reviews.Author: trumelvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here, good hotel, clean comfortable rooms, breakfast baskets very good or you can use the the voucher and have breakfast in Sweetie pies within the hotel. walking distance to the Nappa wine train. This hotel needs a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views from our room”
Reviews.Author: momstephano
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here at the Inn, our room was big with a balcony, fireplace and river view. The bathroom was huge and tiled in marble, like the fireplace. Our dog Ginger got a welcome basket with a bag of cookies she really liked. We enjoyed sitting out on the balcony listening to Eddie Money play live at the Napa County Fair last Thursday night. He still rocks. The Napa River is right outside and it has high and low tides each day. We did a Segway Tour of Historic downtown Napa on Wednesday and that was a blast. We ate dinner at Celadon the restaurant in the hotel, It was very good, try the Prickley Pear Margaritas, Yum . We took the Napa Valley Wine Train for a gourmet lunch on Thursday and it was fantastic. The whole experience with the luxurious dining car, the comfortable parlor car, the great food and the impeccable service from start to finish, is worth every cent. The hotel booked it for us and provided the ride to and from the station.There is free parking in the hotels lot and even more across the street. Everything here was great. We are bringing our son here next year for his 21st birthday, I can hardly wait to come back to The Napa River Inn .

Reviews.Title: “We loved it; the service was impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: Tisha831
Reviews.Content: What a relaxing weekend getaway! Coming from the east coast, I had no clue where to start with my planning but Krystal, the Guest Services Agent, took care of every detail- including referring us to a driver for a private wine tour (www.mynapavalleydriver.com) and securing reservations for the Wine Train. Breakfast was included at a pastry shop but was worth paying the extra for the comfort food at the Napa General Store. Before we departed, Krystal (who's just as nice in person!) helped us with the logistics of shipping our wine home. In all, the location was easily accessible (close to shops and restaurants), the service was warm yet the rooms seemed very private. I've already recommended this hotel to several others and I hope we'll make our way back for a stay as well...

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: For my 35th birthday I wanted to get out of the city (San Francisco) but only had a day off to do it. My partner and I looked online and found Napa River Inn and saw that they offered a Downtown Wine Tasting package. We've never really stayed in downtown and thought the location of the hotel was great. When we arrived in the late afternoon, check in was a breeze and the staff was friendly and helpful. They were able to upgrade our room and, despite the fact that the site said they would charge us $29 for a late check out, the staff said they would do it for free. The room was quaint, clean and best of all quiet even though we had a ground floor room with a balcony by the courtyard. The downtown wine tasting card that came with the package was great. We were only able to hit a few of the tasting rooms this visit but are excited to know that the card is good for 6 months. So we can go back and hopefully visit the other 10 tasting rooms for free. The package was totally worth it! Breakfast was delivered promptly and with a smile. We look forward to staying again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing last minute trip EVER!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olympia W
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take a last minute trip to Napa Valley. There was a large event that was taking place that weekend and Napa River Inn was the only place that I could find an opening at. It was a little pricey which made me reluctant to reserve a room, but it was the best move that I made that weekend. The inn is centrally located downtown walking distance to restaurants, clubs, Napa Valley river and a place that played live music and comedy right next door. The room was amazing and made me feel like I was at home. The room was newly renovated with all the extras that need to come with the room. And the best part is that they deliver you breakfast to your room at the desired time you request.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: marina123987
Reviews.Content: This July we were visiting California, and spent some time in Napa Valley. Beautiful scenery, wine tasting, and above all very nice accommodation in Napa River Inn, made this part of our trip very pleasant. The hotel staff was kind, and Shane Greenan, Assistant General Manager, made us feel very welcome. If you plan to visit this part of California, stay in Napa River Inn, and you will feel as a special guest. Maria & Craig

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jan1947
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and relaxing with a view overlooking the Napa River. The complimentary breakfasts, coffee pot in the room, and water in the refrigerator each day were added benefits. The location was convenient to wine tastings in Napa and Sonoma as well as the Jelly Belly factory. It was also convenient to many great restaurants in downtown Napa and the Napa Valley. We didn't get to use the fireplace on this summer visit, but enjoyed being able to sleep with the windows open at night.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome back”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: Had come here last year with our whole family to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. Was very pleased when I called to book again to learn that they have a returning guest's discount, which made the cost of the hotel extremely good value for Napa. Rooms were great with every amenity, and we cannot recommend hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: FredrikWBU
Reviews.Content: We saw a lot of hotels in Napa before deciding on this one. The entire block of houses is charming and many rooms offer a view of the river. Assuming you are in Napa for wine tasting - pick a hotel that is within walking distance of the town in order to avoid a designated driver. Many of the hotels which are highly ranked here require a drive downtown... Breakfast is served in the room which is a nice touch but it is only a small one to get you going.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: rxteach
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn is a quaint, yet luxurious inn set right on the river. It was our 30th wedding anniversary and they upgraded us to a beautiful corner room with a balcony and sent up complimentary champagne and chocolates. Breakfast from Sweeties Pies was hot and delicious (order the AM bun). We loved that there are several restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: mikew71772
Reviews.Content: Some college friends and I spent a great weekend at the Napa River Inn in July 2011. The property is very unique and offers everything in terms of location, amenities, and convenience. The on-site spa was very nice and the wine tasting bar at the General Store was a great way to start our weekend while we waited for the room (we arrived in Napa before noon - the room was actually ready before normal check-in time). The complimentary breakfast - delivered to your room - was an added bonus. The great location allowed us to walk most everywhere in downtown. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint old historic feel, really nice hotel - will def stay again!”
Reviews.Author: jlsacco
Reviews.Content: We picked the Napa River Inn based on a recommendation from a friend who has gone to Napa several times and always enjoyed it. This hotel was too cute, very historic feel to it. You really feel like you are going back in time. The room was HUGE!! The biggest regular hotel room we have ever stayed in. It was nice having so much room. Free breakfast and internet too. Very convenient to downtown Napa, in walking distance to Bounty Hunter, 1313, and Allegria. All places we tried while we were there. The hotel booked us on the Platypus Wine Tour which was a great day and tour and even shipped the wine back for us. We were very happy with our experience and will definitely stay here again next year when we return to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful historic facility that is clean with modern amenitys”
Reviews.Author: CThurow
Reviews.Content: From check in to dinner everyone was exceptionally polite. Didnt include check out because we had to get to the airport at 2:30 am.... The room was good size with a comfortable bed and fireplace, and the bathroom had everything we needed and everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ayefly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a trip on the wine train celebrating my girlfriends birthday. Didn't know anything about this Inn or downtown Napa's redevelopment - All I can say is what a GREAT surprise EVERYTHING was!!! The Napa River Inn is a fantastic little gem tucked away at the end of Main Street. It is less than a 5 minute drive across the river from the wine train depot. From the moment you enter the lobby you are impressed with the quality and attentive service they pride themselves on. When I booked the room I selected the dining package which comes with a 100 credit for any of the fantastic restaurants that are available in the immediate area. Upon check-in the front desk staff took the time to welcome us and explain how everything works. We got our key and headed for our room. It was spacious, clean, quiet, and romantic! First class toiletries and even a great bottle of Napa Valley wine wishing my girlfriend a happy birthday from the staff!!! We unwound with a glass of wine while we freshened up and then headed over to Tyler Florence's restaurant "Rotisserie and Wine" for our dinner. All I can say is "WOW" Best rotisserie chicken I have ever tasted. First class friendly service, great menu, fun laid back style, and an excellent wine list. Exactly what you would expect here in Napa Valley!!! The following morning we were greeted with our complimentary in room breakfast basket which we had ordered the evening before. It was fresh, delicious, and delivered on time! I can't say enough good things about our experience. From the sweet smells of the fresh flowers outside off our balcony to the evening stroll along the riverwalk, the great comfortable room to the fantastic meals and super attentive staff members - a memorable birthday experience for years to come!!! I will have my work cut out for me trying to top this birthday next year. Maybe the best bet would be to do this all again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: KarenM242
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a night at the Inn as part of a Living Social deal. I was surprised at the beautiful setting, we got a room facing the river in the Plaza Building and everyone was so cordial and welcoming. We arrived too late to experience the wine-tasting at Silo's, but the breakfast from Sweetie Pie's in the morning that was delivered to the room was wonderful. We look forward to spending more time next summer in Napa and will definitely stay at The Mill again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best Choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: macdevelopment
Reviews.Content: I cant imaging that visitors would choose any other. I found this hotel VERY CLEAN a great value with incredible rooms and the overall atmosphere from dining to its bar to its great location. I will definitely be back and you should too

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but not awesome”
Reviews.Author: rhaake
Reviews.Content: The location along the Napa riverfront was wonderful. We very much enjoyed our stay here. The room was a nice size and very clean. We especially liked our balcony overlooking the river where we enjoyed our tasty (and free) breakfast each morning. The proximity to multiple restaurants meant we could just walk back from dinner. The only thing from keeping me from rating it higher was that I wasn't a fan of the decor...very country / floral.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: SanLaJolla_CA
Reviews.Content: We bought a livingsocial deal and stayed at Napa River Inn for one night. We had a great stay at Napa river inn. The room was spacious, clean and bed very comfortable. Breakfast in bed was also a great plus. With the package we also got $100 dining credit to Morimoto Napa, which was a fantastic experience. Well worth the price of the package. The most memorable part about our trip though, was the excellent customer service of the hotel. Starting from the time when we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with great hospitality. After we left the hotel, I realized that we had left our cell phone charger at the hotel and since we're already on our way back, I called Napa River Inn to see if they can mail my charger back to me. At first they said they would FedEx it back to me, and I asked if there's cheaper options. The front desk lady whom I think is named Heather, was really nice and mailed my charger back to me in a regular USPS envelope which only cost 2 dollars instead of $15 had they used FedEx. I really appreciate her efforts because she could have easily just denied my request and use FedEx which is probably easier for her, but she was nice enough to accomodate my request. Definitely the best service I've experienced from any hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Why did you people rate this place 4.5 overall?”
Reviews.Author: Wb48855
Reviews.Content: It's a Hampton on steroids, over priced and next to the ghetto. Wish I would have stayed somewhere nicer however ok for business travel. River view room is not worth any extra, rooms are small and dark.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Redstorm54
Reviews.Content: So disappointed. Second time to Napa. Previously stayed in Yountville. Service was lacking. Cost for room totally not worth the value. Better places to stay for a bit more money

Reviews.Title: “Not historic and not really a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dogsandhorses
Reviews.Content: Far from staying in historic surroundings, we were located in a modern annex (the 'plaza'), that required us to walk out the front door of the hotel, around the corner, and down the street - we didn't enter the hotel again during our two days here until we left, since it also has no breakfast room or dining area (and we later discovered the 'historic' section contains only 6 bedrooms). The modern annex is of the soul-less variety, the decor remains characterless despite being overblown (impossibly high narrow beds, heavily wooden furniture taking up much needed space, floral curtains), and the carpets looked worn - there is nothing 'boutique' about most of the accommodation in this hotel and it is misleading that it calls itself a boutique hotel. There are no staff in the annex and I worried about security - although the door to it requires a room key to enter, it was left propped open during part of the day. Our room was small (far smaller than rooms of the same price that we stayed in elsewhere in San Francisco), had no view, and the 'balcony' could hold one person standing only. We rang reception when we got to the room to ask whether the beds were in fact single beds because they were so small and were told they were not single and not queen and so yes they were double beds. My husband and I slept badly here, there was literally no room to turn over. We had breakfast both days but you are required to have it in your room, an odd arrangement given that there is no table, just a narrow desk, and not enough chairs. The 'workout' room is just the size of a small hotel room itself and has two or three treadmills etc in it and was overly warm when we were there. After staying in great hotels in San Francisco, this was a real disappointment. The remarkable thing about it is that it charged us the same price as the far better hotels with better facilities and real character that we stayed in before and after it.

Reviews.Title: “Always love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelife53
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Napa River Inn. This is our second time staying there. Donald from Beau Wine tours was our limo driver for the wine tour and he did a fantastic job. He knows where to take you and if very knowledgeable. He picks you up and drops you off at the hotel which is wonderful. Not crazy about the french restaurant there, but everything else is great. Make sure you visit Sweetie Pies for their fabulous desserts and breakfast. Krystal set up the wine tour previous to our arrival and went off without a hitch. (Thanks Krystal).

Reviews.Title: “Dwarf Beds & Crumbs”
Reviews.Author: mukdennnis
Reviews.Content: So, this is very expensive for what you get. Big city prices for a small hotel, upped by scarcity I guess. So, they bill this as an historic hotel but there are only a handful of historic rooms. The rest are in a modern axe and are for dwarfs. We had three people and two double beds but they were really narrow and it was very difficult for two to fit in one.then, for thin dwarves right. The other big drawback is that they do not have a restaurant, so you get your Brady in the room. Given that the room is small, this is not a positive experience. We paid $340 a night which is wild for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base to explore downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: DesktopAdventure
Reviews.Content: On short notice I had to go to Napa for a day, and needed to overnight downtown. Fortunately it was midweek and there was a room at the Napa River Inn -- it books up on weekends well in advance. What a great choice. Very nice rooms, attentive but not intrusive service, and a perfect location! Lots to see and do very nearby, including a jazz club next door (Silo's). How cool is that?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaDesertGirl
Reviews.Content: Have made numerous trips to the area, but this is the first time we have stayed in Napa. Loved the location, the rooms with the river view are great and the breakfast delivered to the room was very good. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the center of it all...”
Reviews.Author: Sazelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Napa for the first time last week, and chose this hotel due to location and more importantly, price (prices are outrageous at this time of year). For the money it was definitely worth it - no pool and a tiny fitness center, but it is very well situated within walking distance of several great restaurants and shops. It's also a quick hop to Highway 29 by car, in order to visit all of the area wineries. It's modest and basic, but we were never in the room except to shower or sleep, so we didn't mind. If you're looking for something updated and flashy, or if you're looking to be next door to wineries and vineyards, you probably will want to look elsewhere. However, if you'd rather spend your money on wine tastings and bottles of wine, delicious meals and treat this as your home base, you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette weekend - Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Shania55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn for my bachelorette. There were 10 of us girls between 3 rooms for 3 nights and it worked out perfectly. We choose the Girls Gone Wine package and couldn't have been happier. The package came with breakfast, a bottle of wine upon arrival, and a wine tour. One of my bridesmaids had spoken a lot with the conceirge who was more than helpful. She helped us plan down to the last detail (wine tour, surprises, dinner reservations, shuttle to the airport) -- I think they were friends by the end of it! The restaurant even had free appetizers for the restaurant we went to Friday night. After dinner we went to Silo's and had a blast. We had breakfast delivered each morning (in bed) -- and it was delicious. The wine tour was great, and our driver Darren was a delight! and he's a chef!!! he made our lunch himself and it was so good! He even extended our time for us. We had a private shuttle and Darren took us to the local wineries with reasonable tasting fees. We loved every minute! Thank you!!! we hope to come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: lmsilva85
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Very cute with nice details. It is decorated very well. The room was spacious with a double shower and separate tub. Cozy bed. I would love to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our accommodations & service--we'll return”
Reviews.Author: grampam916
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn was exactly as billed: luxury, service, quality. We arrived early...but no problem: our room was ready and our corner location in the Executive suites was inviting and comfortable. We purchased the "dinner is on us" package and were delighted with our choice at "The Fish Story", a 2-minute walk from the hotel. The food was terrific and the understated decor of the restaurant, as well as the food, were most pleasing. After another short walk we went to a concert at the Napa Theatre. Back to the hotel where we filled out our breakfast menu request and were awakened right on time with a wonderful, tasty meal from Sweetie Pie. Our anniversary celebration at the Napa River Inn was completely what we were hoping for!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ron055
Reviews.Content: Prime location in downtown Napa. At the River. Walk to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Experience, can wait to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: nppatricksf
Reviews.Content: Super freindly and helpful staff. Room was magnificient with a charm that I have not found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Napa Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Be2gether
Reviews.Content: I'm a very detailed person (some would call my anal). I planned a mid-week surprise getaway for my husband and myself and worked to make every detail perfect. Travelzoo had such great deal I couldn't pass up...
