I emailed or called the concierge at least 10 times (probably more) with questions regarding dining, tours, what to see and do in the area as well as making and changing reservations for dinner and tours (finally settling on wine train tour after the concierge so beautifully described it- yes it was perfect!). We checked in a little early but our room was very clean and our wine bottle and glasses were sitting out waiting for us. The rooms are simple and elegant. The turn down service w/ little chocolates ended our evenings perfectly. And the view- we had a balcony and view of the river-very romantic! We decided to have our breakfast at Sweetie Pie for the ambiance and the people, we met and spoke with couples from everywhere-and the breakfast was delish! But way much more than one can or should eat! Luckily they have a great run/bike path right behind the hotel! Everything was in walking distance, downtown, Farmer's Market (every Thursday), restaurants, wine bars, and even our train tour was just a 10 minute walk. The front desk greeted us with a smile and a 'hello' every time we walked in and were always patient and friendly when answering my many questions. I loved the hotel, the service, the location- it made for a PERFECT romantic Napa getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A charming surprise--I'd go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: rmonforton
Reviews.Content: My friends and I recently returned from an outstanding weekend in the Napa Valley. One of the many highlights of the trip was our stay at the Napa River Inn. What an absolutly charming hotel--a true hidden gem at a marvelous price, and a great launching pad to explore the rest of Napa. The hotel was cozy, the beds were phenomenal--every bit as comfortable and soft as a Westin Heavenly Bed. A wonderful bonus: the basket of breakfast items you order the night before and receive delivered to your room every morning, at no additional cost! I would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious Elegance and Excellence”
Reviews.Author: independentthinker54
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel, staff and location was great! We can recommend it without any reservations. It will be the only place we stay in Napa, from now on! The room was quiet and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: coyotetraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Napa River Inn. We were in Napa to ride the Echelon Gran Fondo bike race and to enjoy the wine of the county. The inn was a real treat. The staff excellent, attentive, helpful and very friendly. We loved the setting along the Napa River. Our room was clean, comfortable, and pleasant. We loved the location. What a treat it was to walk to all the great restaurants, stores, and attractions of Napa. This was our first trip to Napa and we were very impressed. We are world travelers and that is difficult to do. Napa is a city that is reinventing itself and they have done a marvelous job. The River walk is fantastic. The hotel is just about right next to Iron Chef MOrimotoes Restaurant. In addition its a short drive to all the best vineyards in Napa County. Now the real deal breaker is that the Napa River Inn is half the price of the other hotels in Yountville, St helena etc. A real steal. We look forward to returning. Oh, the breakfast is brought to your room. What a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners in Napa River Inn - A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: playdobro
Reviews.Content: We loved the Napa River Inn. We stayed in the Embarcadero building. Although we did not have a river view, we were still extremely satisfied with our room. Knowing we were on our honeymoon, the hotel had a bottle of champagne and a nice note ready for us in the room when we arrived. The complimentary breakfast is great, and Sweetie Pie's makes some of the best danishes around. Order your breakfast on the early side of when you'll want it, because we did notice that they usually come at the end of the half hour window you schedule for delivery. The parking situation is free, and extremely convenient. We ate at Napa Morimotos and Angele's during our stay which are both very close to the hotel. Angele's was great from start to finish, and a really cute atmosphere for dinner. We didn't love Morimotos, but that just may be our taste. Location is great, a very easy drive to all of the vineyards, and close to a Walmart, and CVS for any forgotten items in your packing. Highly recommend, would absolutely revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall inn”
Reviews.Author: JonE43
Reviews.Content: The dining package was great so was the breakfast in bed Perfect location in Napa Planning on going again

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, comfortable room with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraAnn_22
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nights here. The room was large with huge comfortable beds. Fluffy pillows and bathrobe and lovely staff made our stay a real pleasure. The staff has plenty of suggestions - perhaps one of the best is the Bounty Hunter - the Napa River Inn gives you free tasting coupons for this wine/beer bar/ restaurant - fun place to drink, eat and chat. We took advantage of the Girls Gone Wine package and enjoyed all of it. The free wifi in the rooms worked faster & more reliably than most other hotels where I've stayed. We used the complimentary bikes to see a bit of local Napa ( and pretended it was exercise.) Our only disappointment was the poor view from our room. The staff tried to rearrange us but there were no alternatives available.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: senorburrito
Reviews.Content: We were heading up north to pick up our daughter from college for the summer. We had one night to spend and were looking for something a little different than a downtown Berkeley hotel or a night in SF (which, admittedly, would also have been nice). We found a terrific deal online for the Napa River Inn, did the math on the drive to Cal from Napa (not bad at all - 35 minutes), and made what turned out to be a great decision to stay at the Napa River Inn. After lunch at the Oxbow Market and a quick walk down First Street and up Main to get our bearings, we checked in a little early at the Inn. No problem. Our guest relations representative was a lovely person and helped explain the Historic Napa Mill complex of which the Napa River Inn is a part, and its amenities. We were given a second floor Deluxe Embarcadero room, which came with a balcony, fireplace, comfy king bed, large bathroom, Keurig coffee maker, flat panel tv, in other words - the works. The balcony overlooked the lazy flow of the Napa River and the train station across the river. The Embarcadero Building, as well as the Hatt Building, are a seamless mix of turn of the century charm with modern amenities, with clean and posh decor and fixtures. We've seen the concept tried in many places elsewhere, but rarely if ever so successfully. Especially since the southern tip of Main Street is full of new, upscale buildings and establishments, e.g., Morimoto Napa, Tyler Florence, it's impressive that the Napa River Inn has been able to maintain the overall Old World feel for the complex. Given our limited timing, we had decided to limit ourselves to one wine tasting before dinner. We had a great time at the Vintner's Collective on Main and Clinton, and then made our way back to dinner at Angele, which is located in the old boathouse in between the Hatt Building and the Embarcadero Building. Dinner on the patio overlooked the river and was covered by the gift certificate we had received as part of the mid-week special package. The next morning, we were served our 'breakfast in bed' from Sweeties, which also was complimentary. We actually ate out on the balcony, and were treated to some colorful hot air balloons taking off across the river. Although we'd have loved to stay longer, we left to fulfill our parental duties, refreshed and impressed. We will definitely be back, and now consider the Napa River Inn the "Gold Standard" for how to spend our layovers from dropping off/picking up our daughter at/from school.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view of the River”
Reviews.Author: MG2002
Reviews.Content: Our overnight stay was fabulous, and the suite was one of the nicest in which we have stayed. Everything was spotlessly clean and cozy, yet very elegant. Our private balcony overlooked the Napa River and was a wonderful spot to sit and smell the wisteria that was in full bloom on the balcony railing. Our room was exceptionally quiet and the king-sized bed was one of the most comfortable in which we have slept (something that is very important for those of us with bad backs). Had the evening not been warm, we would have loved to fire up the fireplace...perhaps next time we will book a suite during the winter. Our morning breakfast was delivered promptly at the time we selected and it was absolutely delicious. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly and even confirmed our dinner reservations (thanks Crystal!)

Reviews.Title: “COZY COMFORT”
Reviews.Author: lisa12450
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely night at your inn checked out the jazz club then went to dinner at zu zu tapas an only had a two minute walk. the bed was better then I have had at any hotel. thanks to all i will be back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: Monica62
Reviews.Content: First time vist to Napa! The Napa River Inn was a wonderful location, with the a bakery, jazz lounge, general store, and restaurant ALL in the same parking lot as the hotel! We didn't have to drive just walk from one wonderful location to the next. Our room was upgraded for FREE and we had a beautiful large room. They stocked the refrigerator with water which was a pleasant surprise. We also loved the Keurig machine in the and to go coffee cups they left us! FREE breakfast was also a lovely surprise delivered to our room. The conceirge desk was a great help and we purchased two wine tasting cards for $25 a piece which was a fun walk around their downtown area! We would totally come back to Napa River Inn. *Great Price*Free Breakfast*Great Morning K-cups*Free Upgrade*Free bottled water* Great Location!

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing rooms in a hotel with a fantastic location for fun.”
Reviews.Author: nandunoon56
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large, with comfortable furniture. The beds are terrific piled high with a comforter and pillows. The mini fridge was a great place to keep drinks cold. Our balcony looked out over the river and the courtyard for the Napa General Store. Very relaxing, something I thought we would need to be further up the Valley for. You could choose from a large variety of items for the breakfast provided. All of this within walking distance to many wonderful resturants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Time to Enjoy Napa? This is the Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mmori33
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a night at Napa River Inn in late April 2011, taking a Wine Train Transportation Free Tour from SF. Hotel itself is situated at down town Napa along side the River and it is a very convenient place to conduct your wine journey there. Many wineries are within a half hour drive, also you can actually walk around the down town Napa from the hotel. Good exercise walk in the morning along the river side. Hotel has lovely cute garden and great to have breakfast at the balcony. You can start a great day with YUMMY breakfast with wide range of selection you can decide from. Hotel service is superb too. We were from Japan and did not have any ideas about how far the each location is from the hotel. As a result we walked to the Napa Outlet Mall and took us more than 30 min. As you can imagine, we were too tired to go back again so we requested a support to the hotel and they actually sent us a car to pick us up (was free of charge). It was great and saved our night there! Front desk and Concierge, they all were friendly and very helpful. I had organized the wine tour on the second day through them and it was great. The tour took us to private Wineries around Napa and had great time. I mean you can spend more cash for high end hotels but I think Napa River Inn is the place to stay if you want to enjoy your time at Napa and make the most out of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn”
Reviews.Author: Chitownboy
Reviews.Content: The Napa River Inn was one of the best places we have stayed. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The location was awesome. We are love going for walks and with tow and the river walk it was perfect. The in room breakfast was on time and excellent. Service was very good. Staff was friendly and very accommodating. Napa River Inn is on the list for another visit. We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday ever!”
Reviews.Author: snowblake55
Reviews.Content: My good friend had just returned form a missions trip n Mexico, tired, worn out and in much need of rest. She had booked an overnight at the Napa River Inn for my birthday . It was an offer through Travel Zoo. Big sigh of happiness and joy when we pulled up and felt the afternoon breeze on our face, and happily was able to open the hotel room windows with beautiful window treatments, to allow the same fresh air into the gorgeous room, overlooking the Napa River. Our complimentarty breakfast was delectable from Sweete Pies (am muffin not to be missed), and my birthday dinner next door at Angeles was perhaps the best dinner I have ever eaten!! I feel I have patronized everywhere from the Ritz, Las Brisas, etc and just loved the Napa River Inn in it's entirelty. It is my new favorite place-combo of elegance and relaxation. I had to miss ridng bikes along the river this time. There will be many next times-!!!

Reviews.Title: “Leisurely and fun”
Reviews.Author: 80amkd
Reviews.Content: The hotel buildings are historic (brick walls, high ceilings, etc) but have all the modern conveniences tastefully added. The hotel is located along the river and just an easy stroll to shops & other sites. Staff was helpful and courteous. The breakfast at Sweetie Pie's was bountiful and delicious. The food and service at Angele was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel. Best night sleep I've had! We both loved it.”
Reviews.Author: barbotey
Reviews.Content: Ate at Morimoto's. Not a sushi fan. My whole fish was the most beautiful presentation I have ever had for a whole fish, but saying that the sauce was so darned hot I could not eat it. Scraped the fish from the back of the fish. Had the seared scallops. Delicious. Too bad the Japanese do not serve bread. That scallop sauce just ached to be sopped up! Left hungry at $139 for the two of us before tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn on the Napa River”
Reviews.Author: daycor
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Napa River Inn! The location is ideal. We stayed in an "Executive Room" which is larger than the standard. We loved the restaurants nearby and look forward to our next stay there. Pamela and Robert San Francisco, CA

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Napa getaway”
Reviews.Author: TRstravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both about to start new jobs and I wanted to plan a special 36 hour getaway in the Wine Country. TravelZoo offered an amazing deal $239 includes one room, $100 gift certificate to Angele for dinner, breakfast for two at Sweetie Pie's, bicycle rentals & two for 1 coupons for winetasting at a number of different wine houses in downtown Napa. We checked into the Napa River Inn & they upgraded us to a River View deluxe room which was lovely. The room was beautifully appointed & spacious, including deep, luxurious bathrobes. The bed was 'heavenly', big, comfy, perfect for an afternoon 'honeymoon'. The Napa River Inn is centrally located & is walking distance to all of the best restaurants in Napa - Angele & Celadon (both next door), Morimoto, Tyler Florence's Rotisserie & Wine, and Fish Story. We walked over to the Oxbow Market for picnic gear and took advantage of the spectacular weather while we drank rose & munched on nibbles. Dinner at Angele under the stars was terrific (they have a new chef). We will (I hope soon) return to The Napa River Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic elegance with convenience.”
Reviews.Author: princessval
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked up to the frontdesk we were greeted by friendly, polite, informative staff. They offered to store our bikes at the front desk. Our room had every possilble comfort thought of top quality linens,pillows,bed, lotions etc. So nice to have all the comforts of home with a private balcony with a view and yet walk two minutes to quality restaraunts, music, shops, spa,riverwalk. We would give this Inn five stars!

Reviews.Title: “This Inn is incredible! Will never stay anyway else again in Napa”
Reviews.Author: RGSmith84
Reviews.Content: Who knew such an elegant, sophisticated, and beautifully understated hotel would exist in downtown Napa. We spotted it on our way to Angele, the restaurant next door, and were captivated by the historical charm of its setting. On a warm evening it was very alluring. When we asked to stay the next morning, the staff was so helpful and courteous, they immediately arranged for a room to be available and we were in by 11 in the morning. It's a peaceful, lovely setting on the Napa River - our room had a fireplace, exposed brick and a great Keurig coffee maker. There are common patios as well to enjoy a glass of wine in the afternoon. Since it is at the end of Main Street there is an "old world" charm about the few blocks of the Mill, ample, safe parking and several excellent restaurants to choose from. How nice to saunter Main Street in the evening, enjoy dinner or a glass of wine and retreat to our lovely room for a nightcap in front of the fire. And the gratis breakfast couldn't have been tastier - the Sweetie Pie bakery had clearly just made the morning buns and the egg sandwiches were just delicious. I honestly don't think I will ever stay anywhere else again while visiting Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Napa River Inn - SO comfy, I hope we will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: slickllh
Reviews.Content: I don't really know how to begin to describe how happy we were to have found the Inn. I searched for an affordable, but centrally located hotel in Napa. I knew it was a shot in the dark, given how expensive most places are, but the Napa River Inn came up.... and they were running a special where you received a $100 dining credit for every night you stayed. I booked immediately after reading reviews here on TripAdvisor. Sadly, we'd be only staying one night. After reserving the room, I received a welcome email and another one shortly after, asking if we needed help making a reservation for dinner. My fiancee and I checked in on a Thursday night - the lobby was completely charming, and the front desk staff welcomed us with a smile. She gave us all the information we needed (as well as our dining gift certificate) and offered to help with anything we needed while we were at the hotel. Parking was plentiful and nearby. Our room was on the second floor... and it was pretty grand. Huge room, great red walls and an inviting king bed. Had a sitting area with a gas fireplace with a large flat screen TV above. The bathroom was just as generous... with a claw foot tub, bathrobes, large vanity, great toiletries, and a two person shower! We headed over to Morimoto Napa, where we had a reservation waiting. Great drinks and appetizers! The included breakfast delivery from Sweetie Pie's next door from the hotel in the morning was fabulous. After checking out (smoothly), I realized that I had to print something, and the desk clerk immediately showed me the way to the printer & what to do. I even fixed myself a complimentary coffee to go from the lobby machine. We only stayed in downtown Napa a little longer, walking around the old Mill area and by the waterfront. It's a very nice area - shops & restaurants, etc. To sum it up, if I'm back in the Napa area, I will be sure to return to the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: TDl_11
Reviews.Content: My daughter took me to Napa as I am from the east coast and had only had limited exposure to Napa Valley. We stayed at the Napa River Inn. The historic beauty of the Inn itself and the service of the professionals who cared for us during our stay was just outstanding. The room we stayed in was spacious, comfortable, clean and elegant. There were nice touches- we enjoyed the warm robes and the exquisite breakfast that was delivered to our room. The front desk staff was very accommodating and helpful in our planning. We have highly recommended the Napa River Inn to our friends and family and look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: mdgib
Reviews.Content: charming hotel,great location,walking distance to everything and a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Sad Comedy Vacation”
Reviews.Author: WineCountryLiving
Reviews.Content: My husband and I gave eachother a night stay here for Valentine's. From the look of the lobby, we were very excited. We bought a package deal complete with dinner and breakfast. When we got to our room, the TV didn't work. We went out to town and asked the front desk to please repair it. When we came back it still didn't work. When we called the desk we were told that she would send a bellman with keys to a new room and he could help us with our luggage. When he came, he gave us keys and left. We lugged our bags to the far building in the rain. The couple we walked in on was rather shocked that we were given the keys to their room. No, I'm not kidding. We went back to the desk and we were sent to another room in another building out in the rain. When we went out to dinner Morimoto's, the service was terrible and the food was dull. The whole night was depressing. At 3AM, we awoke to what sounded like a family of five above us stomping about. They didn't stop until after 8 when we just decided to go get breakfast. My order was wrong and we went back to the room. We had a "do not disturb" sign on our door but the maid let herself in anyway. It was a very disappointing stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: whichard
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my stay at The Napa River Inn. The staff is welcoming, friendly and helpful. The experience at The Napa River Inn is truly unique. They pay attention to all the little details that make the difference in the hotel experience. A bottle of wine in your room, chocolates from the sweet shop downstairs, and breakfast brought to your bed from Sweetie Pies bakery downstairs. They even have nightly turndown service. What I love most about staying at The Napa River Inn is the location. You really can park your car and walk to everything in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Big Bang for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: ibweave
Reviews.Content: Loved the location with all its fabulous choices of restaurants right on the property. Sadly, the Jazz Club was closed the nights we were there, so we'll have to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “A little too rustic”
Reviews.Author: WifeofMichael
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the service at the hotel was very good. Everyone was accomodating and nice. Our room, however, had some issues. The wall ac/heat unit was extremely loud and I had to keep it off during the night to sleep which kept the room very, very cold. After showering the first evening, outdoor friends visited us in the form of ants and something I hadn't seen before. We addressed this with the hotel and someone came in and left a note stating: "Placed 4 ant houses in bath area, hopefully they will leave." Well, they didn't even getting onto the toilet and my husband's pants. Another issue we had was the TV. It was an old tube TV and was discolored around the corners. Again, we included the TV and the ac/heat unit on the work order with the bug problem and the response was: "TV appears to be working fine." and "noise from unit is typical of these units." Breakfast is delivered to the room every morning, but on the first morning the power had gone out (nothing to do with the hotel), and we were delivered what they could. Needless to say, we left the hotel hungry and not even offered a voucher to get something somewhere else. On our last day we were offered a 20% discount or new room.....but it was our last day with an early flight the next morning....it would have been even more stressful to pack up everything and move. We took the discount, but that still didn't get the price of the room close to a very modern hotel in the same area (we checked). The last issue was the wireless. We connected just fine to the hotel's wireless, however, their connection to the internet was horrible. I had to do most of my work on my phone and that was difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Victorian elegance, luxurious ambience”
Reviews.Author: TravelKrazy
Reviews.Content: We had a quiet deluxe room with king bed--no view--in the historical Hatt Building. The room was furnished very beautifully and had very nice amenities including a fridge, a Keurig coffee maker complete with complimentary supplies, water bottles, wine glasses, robes, etc. In addition to a shower stall w/multiple shower heads, there was an antique clawfoot tub for soaking. The fireplace was a nice romantic touch especially since we don't have one in our home. The complimentary breakfast was very good and is made and delivered by Sweetie Pies Bakery next door. The staff was very efficient and friendly and we greatly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodations in Napa!!!”
Reviews.Author: cbashaw88
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this fantastic place. Our first stay was when the NRI was new and the grounds were under some construction. It was amazing! And, now that the grounds are completed, it is even more unbelieveable. This is the best value in Napa. The rooms are what you would expect to find at a 5 star resort. The service is unmatched. The rooms, lobby and grounds are immaculate. Breakfast in bed, Kreuger coffee makers in the room, turn-down service, etc. BUT, the best thing about the NRI is its location...walking distance to 4 of the best restaurants in Napa. As a dedicated foodie, each of these places won't dissapoint. AND, it is also 3 blocks from our favorite wine collective. How convenient! Can't wait to return. 2 thumbs up, 5 stars, and half of the price of some of the upvalley resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled by the experience!”
Reviews.Author: grimmelsperson
Reviews.Content: A girl's weekend was needed and Napa was the spot. We found the Napa River Inn online and could not believe the deal they were offering. We booked 2 rooms and got a $100 dinner gift certificate per night, for some awesome local restaurants and free breakfast delivered by the bakery Sweeie Pies-yum!. Arriving at the inn, we were greeting by a very friendly staff and the check-in process was prompt and easy. The rooms are spacious and the beds were heavenly. The nightly turndown service left us chocolate treats. The coffee maker in the room was the pod kind and was appreciated verses the standard brew unit. The toiletries were grape themed and smelled great. Bathrobes were appreciated after a long day of winetasting. We went to Silos which is attached to the building for some late night cocktails and great live music. A couple of us had spa treatments at LaPele right next store which was a convience.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: rjdavis91
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Napa River Inn to co-celebrate the big 5-0. We chose the Napa River Inn to take advantage of the restaurant certificate special and we were not disappointed. The beds are luxurious and there wasn't anything we could think of that we'd change. Well, actually, except the blinds on the windows. The slats let in quite a bit of light, so I was surprised they didn't have a curtain of some sort. That said, the staff at Napa River Inn are exceptional. From the moment I booked reservations and communicated via email, to meeting them in person, they are all true professionals and super friendly! No stuffy door people here! The breakfast delivered from the cafe next door is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: jojolina
Reviews.Content: Very quaint and nicely located in downtown Napa. The hotel is in walking distance from many really good restaurants. We stayed in the Cpt Hatt Suite which was very nice with a king bed as well as a love seat an a few chairs and a gas fireplace. The wet bar was also nice. The bathroom was sizable with a very nice claw foot tub. It was my first time taking a bath in a claw foot tub so that was pretty cool. The bed was lovely and pretty comfortable. Nice down pillows, down comforter and high grade sheets. Another nice thing was the breakfast that was included with the price of the room. We had a choice between a straight continental or one that included a egg, ham and cheese croissant. It was quite good. The in room coffee is Keurig which is a nice upgrade. The cons- the view from the suite was pretty dismal. it looked over the front parking lot. It would have been nice if it was placed in the back of the hotel overlooking the river. Additionally the next morning I needed to get some work done and wasn't able to because the wireless internet was super slow and kept going in and out. I had to leave much earlier than I had planned because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: mbabgbrb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn over Valentine's Day weekend. We got a great deal on a deluxe room with a balcony and fireplace . The rooms themselves were on the small side but nicely decorated. The beds were comfortable and the staff was accommodating. Breakfast from Sweetie Pie's was excellent. The hotel was in a great location within walking distance to everything in Napa. We didn't have a car and had no problems getting around town. The only criticisms are with the climate control, bath products and gym. The heating and a/c units in the rooms were extremely noisy and would come on multiple times during the night. The shampoo/conditioner/body wash came in small bottles made of very thick plastic that made them very difficult to squeeze. You had to practically scoop the stuff out of the bottles with your finger to get anything. The gym was very small and the home-gym style weight set was not working. However, I would not expect a hotel of this size to necessarily have a great gym. i suspect that the Westin down the road did, but we were looking for something with more of a local flavor anyway so it wasn't a big deal. So overall we had a great time, the price was reasonable, the staff professional and the location was great. The only issues we had, minus the gym, are probably easily fixable. Besides, who goes to Napa to exercise?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: BuddhaBuddy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have lived in the Wine Country our entire lives and have never been wine tasting, so we thought it was time. We were lucky enough to stumble upon a promotion on the Internet for the Napa River Inn where we paid a small amount of money for a great night spent in the small town of Napa. We were greeted by a very nice young man at the front desk. He immediately asked what types of activities we wanted to do during our stay. When we informed him that we had never been wine tasting before and were visiting from Sonoma County, he gave us several coupons and complimentary wine tastings at the local store fronts in town, as well as some excellent recommendations of some wineries to go to. We were very happy with the wineries that he recommended to us. Upon returning to the hotel, we found that the housekeepers had turned down our bed while we were out, which was a very nice touch. Also the heater had been set to low heat, to keep the room at a comfortable temperature for when we arrived back at our room. We had a very nice dinner at a local seafood restaurant and then returned to our room. The next morning, a very friendly man from room service arrived with our breakfast and the newspaper, which he set on the edge of our bed so we could enjoy it in the comfort of the warm blankets. Upon checkout, the friendly front desk staff asked if there was anything else that they could do for us before our departure. We asked for a recommendation of a nice place to walk around town, for which they provided a map, and then we were off. Overall, we loved our stay! The service of the staff was five diamond in my book! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We look forward to staying at the Napa River Inn again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in downtown Napa -- everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 87cvx
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a night and had an excellent time. The room was amazing...large king and queen bed, fireplace, great victorian decor, spacious bathroom with a huge tub and large shower with multiple shower heads. No details were overlooked. We were greeted with breakfast from sweetie pies and ate in bed. We were accomodated with a late checkout (2pm!!) upon request. They were very helpful with dinner reservations and suggestions on nearby wineries. At the back of the hotel there are tables where we took a bottle of wine and watched the sunset over the Napa River. We ate at Angele's (excellent) which is practically next door. We couldn't have asked for anything nicer!! We highly recommend this place and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: voyaginmama
Reviews.Content: Recently had the good fortune to spend a night at the lovely Napa River Inn with my teenage daughter. We were upgraded (without being asked) to an enormous room overlooking the Napa river with a balcony and a working gas fireplace. I understand that this is the 'new' wing as opposed to the historic main house which is supposed to be lovely as well, though I didn't get a chance to view the rooms. From the excellent in room coffee machine to the free wireless to the EXCELLENT beds we had a delightful stay. We did not avail ourselves of the room service breakfast option provided by the near by Sweetie Pie Bakery, but it did look excellent. The location of the Inn is perfect, especially if you don't have a car, because there are many fine restaurants on the riverside, and many more within strolling distance in 'downtown' Napa. We really were just passing through, but I really look forward to returning and spending more time in this special hotel and in this very special area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy elegance on the Napa River”
Reviews.Author: SFAstrid
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of our room--on the river with a small balcony. Bed was very comfortable--even for my 6'4" husband. Slept with the fireplace on and the french door part-way open--perfect sleeping temperature/ambience. Walked about 50 feet to Angeles Restaurant where we had a great dinner with out friends on the Dinner Package. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location downtown, great value”
Reviews.Author: kate680
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Napa and are so glad we stayed at the Napa River Inn. We had a room overlooking the Napa River with a balcony and a gas fireplace. Breakfast was delivered in the morning from the bakery next door and it was delicious and filling. Walking distance to all the wineries included in the Downtown Napa Wine Tasting card and you can purchase the card from the hotel. It was also walking distance to the Oxbow Public Market and all of downtown. The Napa General Store is a couple doors away. I would recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vaantonio
Reviews.Content: The Napa Inn is a quiet, cozy B&B. We enjoyed the sitting room with fireplace. They provide Port & Sherry w/ crackers & cheese as well as cookies in the evening. The breakast of blueberry french toast w/ sausage was great.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a great location in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Cameron777
Reviews.Content: Elegant rooms, with high quality finishings, great bed. We had a view over the river (although being on the ground floor we had to have our blinds down to protect our privacy from the people walking along the riverside path). We loved the Sweetie Pie bakery-style breakfast which was included in the price. We also signed up for the Dinner package, which had a higher room rate but we got $100 certificate per room per night for one of four nearby restaurants. We worried that there may be some "catch" in being able to use the certificate but there was none that we could find - you just had to use it all up at one sitting. That made this expensive hotel more modest in price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FoodTravelerAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first stayed at the Napa River Inn in 2009 for our wedding in Napa. We came back this year for our anniversary and loved it just as much...if not more, than before. The hotel is in a great location, among not only downtown and riverfront Napa, Oxbow, etc., but also boasts many great attractions within the complex itself. Sweetie Pies for breakfast or a snack will not disappoint (their pastry case is baffling), the General Store contains many great gifts, the candy shop on premises will not disappoint your sweet tooth; and if those weren't enough, there are two 3 other places to eat all within the complex; from casual to fine dining. Though not tried personally, the hotel also has it's own Spa. When staying at this hotel, you will be within walking distance of great downtown activities & sites. Staying here will leave you feeling like a king or queen, especially if you book a historic room. The amenities are generous and very good quality. Historic rooms boast claw foot tubs, fireplaces, and two-person showers! The luxuriously appointed beds are very soft and cozy, but I'm only giving four stars because sometimes noise from neighbors or hallways can wake you up (though this is normal for hotels). If you want to have a memorable time staying in Napa, don't pass this hotel by. Sometimes a killer deal can even be found on Expedia if the rates seem to high. Don't worry, it's totally worth every penny and won't cost you an arm & a leg like many other top quality resorts will.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mary32849
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to downtown Napa for many years so we were pleasantly surprised to see how nice it is now. Many of the old buildings have been renovated and have become interesting shops and restaurants. The Napa River Inn is in the historic Hatt building. It's been beautifully updated while retaining the original charm and character. The front desk staff were very professional and accommodating. I asked if it would be possible to get a quiet room and the next thing we knew we were upgraded to a quiet, spacious room in the adjacent building (the Embarcadero building). The room had a river view and a fireplace and was very comfortable. Breakfast was provided by Sweetie Pie bakery downstairs...great scones, muffins etc. The inn gave us discount cards for several wineries in the valley so we tried a couple. We also took some nice hikes in Alston Park and Westhills Park. Dinner at Wine & Rotisserie was delicious. All in all a wonderful getaway. We'll definitely be back and highly recommend the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding riverside experience.”
Reviews.Author: 04ADuck
Reviews.Content: We spent my wife's birthday at this beautiful riverside hotel and enjoyed it greatly. Downtown Napa is coming alive!

Reviews.Title: “On your next trip to the wine country”
Reviews.Author: 4annielee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn overnight for our company Holiday Party. Dinner at Celedon was fabulous and our party went off really nicely. But, oh my, what a lovely stay at the Napa River Inn! Everything offered at the Napa River Inn from the greeting at the reception desk to the room service was first class. This is a well appointed, nicely decorated and unfussy hotel that I certainly recommend. We really enjoyed the river view and the fireplace and hearing the Wine Country Train go by was charming. Next time you visit the wine country don't forget to go downtown for a little shopping. The Oxbow Market on First is a delight. And of course, you really must stay at the Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “great napa spot, great value”
Reviews.Author: JAZ4444
Reviews.Content: we loved this quaint hotel. beatiful views, and great location in the town of napa. can walk to restaruants and shops. our room came with a free wine tasting at a great restaurant down the street. best breakfast ever. delivered right to your room. egg sandwich, drink, and pastry. yum! we got the girls gone wine package which retails at $100 per person and includes an all day wine tasting tour with platypus tours. picks you up right at the hotel. (only worthwile money wise if you stay only 2 nights)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect... Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tcabaco
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. My girlfriend and I are fans of Napa, we stay there roughly 5 times a year and we have to say that this is by far the most amazing hotel we've been too. Super cozy, romantic and elegant. The room was fantastic with lots of space, quiet and charming. I purposed to my girlfriend the night we stayed there. I had plans and let the staff know about them before hand. I asked them for a couple of timing changes on the romance package I picked, and they complied with everything in such a professional, helpful and kindly manner. Everything was perfect.. just perfect! Location and quality was everything. My girlfriend thought the hotel was the surprise I had planned, since it was so elegant, romantic and charming. Then I surprised her further with a couples massage on the hotel's spa. The staff there were equally helpful and the quality of the service was amazing. After that we went for a walk along the river and ended up picking a restaurant just three blocks away. To top things off they have a complimentary breakfast in bed service that is UNBELIEVABLE. Things could not have been more perfect. I thank the Napa River Inn for such an amazing and unforgettable day. We'll see each other soon!

Reviews.Title: “Our trip's highlight”
Reviews.Author: kdouglas78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napa River Inn for a weekend get-away and it delivered. Our room was so comfortable and romantic. Everything was very clean and the staff was very nice. We will stay there again for sure and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RNPOLISH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn for our birthday weekend, so it was important to us that our experience was positive. The hotel is dog-friendly and the staff made us and our pooch feel comfortable right away. Our room was beautiful - we had a room with a river view, balcony and a gas fireplace. Despite the rainy weekend, the fireplace did a great job making us feel warm and cozy when we were in our room. We requested a king bed, however, our room has two full beds. I presume we could have been more proactive about making a change, as sharing a bed was a bit tight for two adults, but we liked our rooms so much that we did not pursue a room change. The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff was visible throughout our stay. The hotel is very close (a block or less) to several new restaurants in Napa, including Morimoto and Tyler Florence. Additionally, several highly-rated restaurants were within a few blocks, such as Angele, Celedon and Fish Story. The hotel provided town car service (the bellman was a bit of a crazy driver) to the Napa Valley Wine Train and promptly picked us up when we returned from our adventure. The one complaint is that the hotel is in an older building and you could hear every step and sound from the room above us, including an active child and the housekeeping staff vacuuming early in the morning. I would definitely return, however, and recommend this hotel to friends. The location and helpful service were huge bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “Napa River Inn and Silos are wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaAstles
Reviews.Content: After some business in San Francisco, my wife flew into SFO and we headed to Napa for a long weekend for her 40th birthday. What a wonderful trip. While the Napa River Inn had many possible packages to pick from, I had so many "things" I wanted to do I had to call them and set up a combination of multiple packages. While we only stayed two nights, out package included tickets to Silo's to see Zoo Station ("the" U2 tribute band), wine tours, the Napa Valley Wine Train Vista Dome for dinner, and lots of other amenaties. Everything, even God providing sun and temperatures in the 70's/80's was wonderful. The service and everything at the Napa River Inn was wonderful, the Wine Train was terrific, and our wine tours were great, but one of my most memorable experiences was meeting the owner of Silo's. Hearing that he viewed his life as near perfect, getting to ride his bike to work everyday, drink great wine, and listen to live music, it was difficult to argue otherwise. On our second night after disembarking the wine train and walking back to the Inn and past Silo's, the owner saw us, and ushered us into Silo's, ushered us to a table, and told us to enjoy the music never mentioning the cover charge and even telling us to "never mind' the two item/drink minimum. THIS is what makes me love our Napa experience and want to come back. I have already spread this story to friends/families and will continue to. What better advertising is there than that. The wine in Napa was wonderful and my weekend escape with my wife was everything I could have imagined and asked for. Thanks to the Napa River Inn, Silo's, Napa Wine Tours, and the Napa Wine Train for helping make some lasting memories for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Mom's 70th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: seanchron
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for my wife and I to take my mom to hear Kellie Fuller sing at Silo's (with Mike Greensill) on her 70th birthday; saw the discount price for staying at Napa River Inn, and liked the convenience. This led to exploration of other guest options, which resulted in another night's stay. We had dinner at Celadon, which was beyond perfect. Coordinated with Kellie to sing "Happy Birthday" to my mom, and Keith from Silo's helped arrange delivery of a nice cake (from Sweetie Pies) to our table, and it was a lot of fun for my mom. Breakfast room service the next day was perfect, as was the lunch service on the Napa Wine Train. The weather cleared up enough for a nice walk around Napa. Then, dinner at Angele was, yet again, perfect. A big "Thank You" to all the staff at Napa River Inn, and to everyone at Celadon, Silo's, Sweetie Pies and Angele -- and to Kellie Fuller and Mike Greensill -- for making my mom's 70th birthday special and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite lodging in a super location.”
Reviews.Author: Forestvillian
Reviews.Content: We had stayed previously in the River Plaza Bldg. and this time wanted to experience a room in the historic Hatt Building. Our 2nd floor room was quiet, just as I'd requested, and featured a canopied King bed with an extremely comfortable mattress. There were 2 arm chairs and a large cushioned ottoman, 2 bureau chests, a writing desk, flat panel TV and gas fireplace. The one small window let in just a bit of light, so the room remained fairly dark throughout the day--but I appreciated the fact that the original windows were retained in this historic bldg. Another charming element was the original tongue and groove wood flooring. Amongst the numerous amenities in our room: an in-room safe, coffee maker, electric tea pot, (2) phones, wine glasses, hairdryer, and lots of nice, thick bath towels. The very spacious tiled bath had a slipper tub for soaking and a BIG walk-in shower with 2 shower heads and fold-down seat (the room was handicapped accessible). The only "complaints/suggestions" would be to add towel racks since there were few places to hang our towels, and to include a small table in the room where we could eat breakfast. As it was, my husband had to hunch over the ottoman and I just stood up to eat with the breakfast tray on the bed. (Our Plaza room had a table out on the balcony so we were able to have breakfast there). Also, my cup of coffee wasn't very hot when it arrived (an individual carafe would keep it hot), and my breakfast sandwich was a bit soggy. The 2nd floor had a large, comfortable sitting room that would be quite a nice place for a group or extended family to gather and relax together. The professional service provided by the friendly hotel staff was faultless. We loved the beautifully maintained grounds and lush plantings (roses in November!), the artwork and sculptures on the premises, the charming shops and Siloâ€™s jazz club in the Napa Mill complex, the adjacent River Walkway, Riverfront shops, and the very close proximity to restaurants and other popular venues in Napa town (like Oxbow Market, the Opera House and the Wine Train). We dined at Celadon and Ubuntu (which were both excellent), and it was also a very short walk to Morimoto, Fish Story, Bounty Hunter, Zuzu, Cole's Chop House and other great restaurants. Be assured that during your stay at Napa River Inn, youâ€™ll be able to park your car (for free) and just leave it there till youâ€™re ready to travel on!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive...”
Reviews.Author: jaydee13
Reviews.Content: Great location BUT!!! quite expensive for the value delivered. Breakfast was a stale pastry, luke warm coffee and a very ordinary egg sandwich. Not what I would expect for a $350.00/night hotel (Including tax). The "Free Wine Tasting" consisted of a 2 oz. pour of an ordinary house Sauvignon Blanc that probably wholesaled at $3/btl. Total cost to the hotel about $0.25. The room was nice but a little on the small side given the price, had a decent river view and a little balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, beautiful room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: maggielke
Reviews.Content: We loved our beautiful and comfortable room in a lovely old converted mill. The service was excellent; even loaned us an umbrella. It was very well located--on the river (beautiful), within walking distance to quaint shops and restaurants, and quick access to both Hwy 29 and the Silverado trail. The wine train leaves from here and bikes are available. We did not have a chance to eat at Celedon, but it looked charming. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The manager at the Inn was VERY accomodating and made our experience perfect.”
Reviews.Author: mimchris
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival to the Inn we were initially quite disappointed in the location of our room. We had just spent 2 days in SanFrancisco, in the rain in a room with no view. Our first room at the Inn was very nice, but a fig tree blocked our view of anything and made the room quite dark...not what we were looking for. They upgraded us to an bright sumy room with a view and a fireplace...just what we wanted. Keurig coffee maker in the room was perfect and delivery of breakfast fro Sweety Pies was perfect...the delivery fellow was quite pleasant. Location was great. A short walk to everything. Celedon was a perfect place to dine and just outside our door. We had a very pleasant stay and would advise staying here for the experience AND the location.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and cool”
Reviews.Author: Jonbon2
Reviews.Content: After leaving the hustle and bustle of San Francisco behind the Napa Mill was a welcome rest stop. Location is just right, a little out of town bit close enough to look around. We booked the wine train and the hotel offered complemtary transfers What service! The room was large with a fantastic bed ( we wanted to take it home) good coffee maker with good coffee to boot. Little touches like robes chocolates and turn down service and a lovely breakfast served to your door at a time you request. Simply has to be a jewel in Napa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots to like...few things to fix”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days here. This is a nice, well run hotel in an excellent location. The restaurants near it are a definite plus (from the General Store cafe to upscale Morimoto's) and the downtown will be even better when other restaurants, clubs and tasting rooms are finished. Staff is nice, breakfast brought to your room from Sweetie Pie's is very good. Celadon (their premier restaurant) is excellent. My quibble is with the Plaza rooms. While they are in a new building, there are a few oddities that need to be addressed, e.g. only one mirror in the room; only a clothes rack in the bathroom (i.e. no closet); no in-room safe which requires you to carry purses, wallets more than you would like. While patios/balconies off the rooms are nice, but can be noisy with traffic and construction across the river. The rooms are very clean, though. Recommend Carpe Diem (tasting room/restaurant)...a cool place and only a couple of blocks away. Avoid the new Fish Story restaurant until they shake out the service kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: mimioftwins
Reviews.Content: Napa River Inn is a beautiful place to stay and is conveniently located within walking distance of most everything. The breakfast from Sweetie Pies was wonderful and the General Store restaurant was delicious!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cathystacy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hatt Suite in the historic part of the hotel, and loved it. The decor is really cool, and I would recommend it. Hardwood floors (with rugs), 20 foot ceiling, separate seating area with fireplace and original brick walls. And a claw foot tub. I felt like I had stepped back into the 19th century, but with plenty of modern conveniences: Keurig coffee-maker, flat screen t.v., nice bathroom. I received breakfast at my door at the time I selected, and it was wonderful. Great location. Only negative was the A/C did not work very well, and the staff never got it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spanou
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Excellent service and ideal location. We had breakfast served to us every morning and it was delicious (included with our stay). The room was huge, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. There are two restaurants within walking distance...we chose to go to Celadon and it was delicious. The grounds were beautiful and we had a nice walk after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Embarcadero building rooms are best”
Reviews.Author: Jallan123
Reviews.Content: For the city of Napa, this is a good location. we went through 3 rooms, two in other buildings and 1 at Embarcadero building. Glad we did, the room has much charm..though small, it is much nicer than the other newer rooms. The staff had no problem changing us three times to the Embarcadero building. Thank you! places to eat..right next door at Angele at the bar...best atmosphere at bar, good drinks. we looked at other places to eat, glad we settled here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Retired11yrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and really enjoyed the view from our patio, right onto a lovely garden facing the river. The breakfast from Sweetie Pies was great, more than we could eat and very tasty. It is a great location to take day trips from around the area and the restaurant on premises, Celedon, was very good, casual but up-scale. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “OK - But Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: Booked Napa River Inn based on TA reviews. In this case, gotta say should have avoided. Nice clean hotel, but too many other issues. Booked an "executive" double with 2 beds. First room was ground floor, not very nice at all, and worst of all had the place to hang your clothes in the BATHROOM. Yes you read that correctly. What where they thinking? The front desk was no help at all in getting a different room, but the bell man saved us with some quick thinking. He was the only real positive spot of the stay. We were moved to a much nicer room on the second floor (of three), but overlooking an outdoor cafe and the river. If you do stay, be SURE to book a third floor room otherwise you will hear your neighbor overhead everytime they walk. The "river" is only a river at night when the tides come in, otherwise during the day it is simply a mud hole with no water in it at all. Really. The cafe is of course noisy during the morning and at other times, so you cannot enjoy the miniscule balcony at any time. Other rooms also overlook the restaurent located adjacent to the hotel, which is a great restaurent but not meant to be looked on from your hotel room. Just awful placement of restaurents unfortunately. It was pretty hot when we where there so the AC had to run all the time, which helped drown out the noise since it was so noisy itself. These are old style in the wall AC units that have 2 speeds, useless and runway takeoff speed. I had to "build" a wall of cushions on a chair to keep the AC from blowing hard in my face all night. Dreadfull. Any positives at all? Yes it was very clean and had a good location and free parking. Bottom line, this on NOT a "luxury" hotel, and should be avoided by those looking for an upscale place to stay. Try the new AVIA, wish we had. Sorry - don't know how this ended up as #3 according to TA travellers. I will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Romantic”
Reviews.Author: debwost
Reviews.Content: What a lovely experience. After reading several other reviews we decided the Napa River Inn would be perfectly suited to our needs and we were not disappointed. The rooms were spacious and quiet with the amenities you would expect. The bed was very comfortable and plush. We were greeted warmly and promptly by the staff. The location was ideal for shopping and dining all very nearby (within walking distance) and there will be even more in the coming year with the revitalization of the area in general. We couldn't have asked for a more romantic 20 year anniversary celebration. Cheers to you Napa River Inn, a job well done! Paul and Deb W.

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect first anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: peepee415
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay somewhere special for our first wedding anniversary, and we both decided on Napa. We had never been there before, but have always wanted to visit. Upon arriving, the front desk assocaite informed us that we had been upgraded to a suite, which of course was awesome! When we got to our room, we were both in complete awe. All the details blended perfectly together, and we were 250% satisfied!! We certainly wish we had stayed for longer than we did, but would love to return to the Napa River Inn in the future!!! It was a perfect way to celebrate ou first anniversary!! Thank you Napa River Inn for making our trip so memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “tremendous experience”
Reviews.Author: kasmithbsn
Reviews.Content: I and my partner spent the labor day weekend at the hotel and had very beautiful room with a patio next to the mosaic picture which is beautiful and the gardens are beautiful. The staff is vey helpful and curteous and they set up the whole weekend for us.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Damn Place to stay and really enjoy Napa”
Reviews.Author: funcrzn
Reviews.Content: As President of the Lincoln Hills Sports Car Group of Lincoln California, I wanted to take a group of our club members to Napa and ride in a Balloon over Napa Valley and visit wineries. I used to live in Napa for 30 years and recently moved when I retired. Its always fun to come back and enjoy the life Napa has to offer. Therefore, I had prior knowledge of B&B's / Hotels to choose for visiting and decided Napa River Inn had the best to offer our group. Napa River Inn provided the best location for parking our sports cars, providing excellent location to restaurants, and enjoying beautifully quiet rooms (with great views). The concierge was great for helping line up our Balloon Ride and other adventures. Plus, we were provided redemption vouchers for breakfast at Sweetie Pies which was a very pleasent suprise! I highly recommend Napa River Inn to anyone looking for a location in downtown Napa that is close and within walking distance to some of the best places in downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: wnmorical
Reviews.Content: Breakfast from Sweetie Pies is awesome and forced us to lounge around in the morning...tough duty! The rooms are lovely and spacious and the view of the river is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Napa get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: mchu
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to try Iron Chef Morimoto's new restaurant in Napa. We knew we would be drinking and be out late and wanted a good hotel nearby. Wala! Napa River Inn, which is located just across the street from Morimoto's. A great staff greeted us. Our room was clean and quiet, great coffee maker (can't remember the name) with wonderful green tea, two robes, toiletries, and an ironing board. One thing lacking was a mirror in the bed area. One mirror in the bathroom only does not work for two women. Napa River Inn is located right alongside the Napa River and the morning stroll was wonderful before we enjoyed our complimentary bountiful breakfast.on our balcony overlooking the Napa River. Such a beautiful setting! Included with the cost of our room (besides breakfast for two) were two complimentary tickets to Silo's where a great reggae band was playing, complimentary bottle of Napa cabernet sauvignon wine, box of chocolates, two wine glasses, plus the bed was turned down before we returned from Silos. We know we'll be back at the Napa River Inn because we know we'll be going back to Morimoto's to enjoy the extraordinary food and service.

Reviews.Title: “The little extras make a huge impression!”
Reviews.Author: ksechard
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and I would be happy to stay here again! The room was a spacious surprise with a fireplace and a Kuerig coffee maker in the room. The cream was stored in the refrigerator along with 2 free bottles of water. We went out for dinner with friends and when we returned, the bed had been turned down with chocolates on the pillow and our ice bucket had been filled! There was a common balcony upstairs for us and the large river walk area had so much seating it never seemed crowded. The breakfast was delivered right on time and the staff was impeccable. I had the soundest night sleep that I have ever had and felt right at home when I slipped into the hotel robe after my morning shower. All of these little extras will definitely bring me back to The Napa River Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Centrally Located Place on the Napa River”
Reviews.Author: 2CtheWorld4Two
Reviews.Content: After much research via TripAdvisor, we decided on the Napa River Inn as home for the next three days in â€œWine Country.â€� It was the perfect choice! Although originally built in 1862, it has been nicely restored to accommodate the most descerning guest while keeping the charm intact. Within walking distance of the town of Napa (and some awesome eateries... see my reviews), it was quiet (thick, brick walls), clean, and tastefully decorated. The king-sized bed was... well... like sleeping on a cloud! From the front desk to the cleaning person, the staff was friendly, efficient, and eager to please. Having some wonderful places to eat, shop, and be entertained right on the property, gave us options to linger or explore the town. We did both. Three days was too short but just long enough to rest, relax, and discover the wonderful hidden gems of the Napa/Sonoma wine country. It was nice to come home to the Napa River Inn after a long day of exploring. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “birthday pamper”
Reviews.Author: lisa12450
Reviews.Content: stayed one night for my daughters birthday. we were greeted with a treat of strawberries an bubbly also a nice birthday card for kim very sweet. we had massage at your spa. lovely service perfect weather. had cocktails an a great dinner all in walking distance. will look forward to coming back

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Primitivo-2007
Reviews.Content: The Napa River Inn exceeded my expectations with their first-class service and top-quality rooms. When I am traveling alone, I like to feel that I am in a safe and secure hotel and the The Napa River Inn had a locked door into the building where my room was located and this made me feel very safe. My room was furnished beautifully with an extremely comfortable bed and it was very quiet. The service was exceptional. I left my dry cleaning in the closet and The Napa River Inn held it for me until I was back in town a few days later to pick it up. The complimentary breakfast was very good with many options from the local bakery. This hotel is in walking distance to many great restaurants and wine bars. I am happy that Napa has a great hotel the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Historic building, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sajackie54
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the historic deluxe rooms. Which was exceptional, had all the facilities you could want. We ordered the included breakfast in our room & it was delicious. This hotel is in a good loction for touring the Napa valley.

Reviews.Title: “That river view ain't much to look at and the ceilings are thin...”
Reviews.Author: MargaretandCo
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night based on reviews. Nice amenites and well furnished rooms. Clean and comfy beds. But none of that matters if you cannot get any sleep because of the noise of the person above you. Although we had Bigfoot staying in the room above us, I could tell that anyone walking made the floor creak and bang. I could hear his toilet flush, I could hear when he went out the front door, when he opened his patio door, when he rolled his luggage, and when he argued with his wife/gf until 3 a.m. SO, get a room on the top floor only (3rd floor). Dont waste money for a "river view"--the Napa River along this section looks more like a dirt canal with a used car lot and industrial zone on the opposite side.

Reviews.Title: “If I can't stay at the Napa River Inn, I don't go to Napa.”
Reviews.Author: shawnta76
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Napa River Inn for a 2-night "Best Friend Get-a-way" to visit some of our favorite wineries. We had some challenges leaving town and getting there, so by the time we did check in, we were a little harried to say the least. Walking up to the counter and checking in we were greeted by a very friendly gentleman who asked us how we were doing. We jokingly said that we were fine now that we were here and described some of our "drama" laughingly. He said that he hoped they could make our experience better since we were returning guests. Free upgraded room! Score! We walked in to our room - gorgeous! It was in the historic Hatt Hall, original wood flooring, bathroom had a claw foot tub and gorgeous vanity. Fireplace, sitting area, just everything was perfect. There was a bottle of wine sitting there with a note from the management welcoming us back. As always from past experience, the room was immaculate. Everything was just so. One of my favorite parts of staying at Napa River Inn is the breakfast that is brought up to your room each morning. The breakfast is included and is prepared by Sweetie Pies Bakery which is in the same building. You get a pastry, choice between a breakfast sandwich, granola parfait or the quiche du jour, and you also get freshly squeezed juice or fresh fruit. You just tell them what time to bring it and they bring it right up. And it's all included in your room fees! The location is great too, it's right on the Riverfront and walking distance to downtown restaurants like ZuZu, Downtown Joe's. Morimoto Napa, etc. This is the only place that I will stay in Napa. If they are booked, I don't go. They have made such an impression and have proven to me that they take Customer Service seriously. If you want a great Napa experience, stay here. It's that simple.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel for myself and my 2 dogs”
Reviews.Author: m1canine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn last September and were so impressed that we included it for our summer trip in 2010. I have 2 small dogs that are family and the welcome basket that is in the room upon arrival was most welcome. We got to stay in the same room both last year and this year so felt like we had come home. I can't say enought about the friendliness for the staff, the effeciency of housekeeping, general overall cleanliness, etc. The included breakfast from Sweetie Pies is fabulous! Having traveled world wide - the Napa River Inn ranks among the best in my estimation. I look forward to my next visit. I think of it as a 5 star, 5 paw hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quant Inn”
Reviews.Author: Panzampa
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night here but would love to go back. I found it very quaint and easy to get to. A few downtown restaurants and cute shops onsite. Even got a picture in Sweetie Pie's with an orb-supposedly it is haunted.

Reviews.Title: “Love the bed, great friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Shoredee
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the amenities were good. I loved the bed, it was so comfortable, the pillows and comforter were goose down and so wonderful to sleep with. We stayed in one of the executive rooms, it was nice and had a little patio on the river side. They had complementary car service which was such a wonderful service to have. We went on the wine train and they took us and picked us up from there. Such a great thing to have and made our night on the train even that much more enjoyable. The staff was all very friendly. The location was great, because you can just walk down town to go shopping and have a great night out at yummy restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for us/Great for our dog!!”
Reviews.Author: liveoakcellars
Reviews.Content: This is a well-appointed hotel on the river. Beautiful grounds,fireplace in room and made to order breakfast delivered to your room are elements that insure a return trip. The staff was courteous and helpful,the rooms are clean and well-maintained. The dog basket with blanket,bowls and treats was thoughtful and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing one stop shop”
Reviews.Author: rach4282
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. The room and bathroom was huge and the view was beautiful. We also really liked that there were two restaurants on site as well as a club. We did not even leave the area until we left the next day for wine tastings. Also, everyone there was super nice and accomodating. The breakfast the next morning was delicious as well. The only thing I did not really like was the price. That is the reason we only stayed one night. However, it was definitely luxorious and if you can afford it, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very nice, staff tries hard to please.”
Reviews.Author: Carl5088
Reviews.Content: We will be back, great place to stay if you have a little dog.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views and Wonderful Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Elvie
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel....the view of the river from our room was beautiful...there were walking trails, parks and the town of Napa has a certain New England feel...my family would highly recommend staying here. We will be back. FYI...the hotel is pet friendly and our Shih Tzu enjoyed his trip as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacksters01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa River Inn for seven nights and had a fantastic time. The breakfasts were delicious, the service was outstanding, and the accommodations were incredibly comfortable. They even had a bottle of Cabernet and chocolates waiting for us on our arrival. Best part of our trip and a great location for wine-bar hopping in the evening (use the Bountyhunter free tastings the hotel gives out). Pay a little extra and upgrade the rooms to one of the historical ones.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpkjvinci
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Napa River Inn twice and have thoroughly enjoyed our visit both times. Our second visit was on July 4th, so we were able to enjoy the July 4th fireworks from our balcony overlooking the river ... what a treat! We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jendog777
Reviews.Content: The room at the Napa River Inn was quaint and luxurious and located right along the Napa River. The hotel staff, especially Alicia, were most attentive and brought us a roll-a-way bed, extra bath fizz's and an extra robe as there were three of us in the room...three sisters on a wine and food tasting extravaganza. The bed was large and cozy and made for a very lovely night's sleep. And the restaurant recommended to us by the front desk staff...the Bounty Hunter...was a hit. Great food, walking distance from the restaurant and lots of fun! And our drive to and from the wineries was easy to access as Napa and the Inn are close to the Silverado Trail which is where we spent most of our time. It was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jrwilsonCameronPark
Reviews.Content: Generally a nice hotel, pretty good service, but not worth the price. $370 a night, but no pool or anything. The area right around the hotel wasn't very nice, under construction. Parking was a pain. The restaurants (angele and Sweetie Pies) were overpriced and not good at all. Couldn't finish dinner at angele and our 3 year old wouldn't even touch the macaroni and cheese, which smelled horrible.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice stay. Grew on me.”
Reviews.Author: PinballSeeker
Reviews.Content: Trip started a little rocky. Did not get the room amenity I wanted despite arriving very early on a Friday. Location also looked better on the website. It is separated from the rest of downtown by 2 very bare blocks (business wise), so you have to walk a little bit to get to any other destination. Room was a bit small, as was the bathroom. So after paying 350 a night, I was definitely a little worried. However, we had a nice snack at Bounty Hunter and caught a live band at the park only 2 blocks away so things were looking up and the room was cozy. My wife also liked the onsite amenities including Sweet Tooth (pastry/chocolcates/coffees) . Morning breakfast is delivered and the food was very tasty. Definitely not Costco muffins here. And Napa downtown is a fairly leisurely 20 minute drive to the first vineyards, so certainly close enough for anyone driving. After spending the whole day at wine tastings, we completed the day with dinner at Allegria, and the food was exquisite. We were too tired to go to Silo's (onsite dance/music club) but it was nice that it was an option. So, our stay improved as it went on, and I have no regrets staying there. If you don't mind a short walk, you are close to most downtown destinations, and if you don't want to leave, you have 2 resturants, a "sweets" shop, a music/dance club, and a view of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: foodcritic916
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Napa River Inn. The service is excellent. The rooms are so comfortable with big soft beds, fireplaces , marble bathrooms , breakfast served in your room . I have stayed twice and will stay again in the fall. With many restaurants within walking distance and wine tasting and music on the property, you don't need to leave it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Napa Valley Inn”
Reviews.Author: Whiteway
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Google maps when seeking downtown hotels on the River in Napa. Then I checked the comments from travellers on TripAdvisor and finally visited the web site and I was very impressed with the web site. The fact that parking is free and breakfast was included in the nightly rate made our decision very simple to make. I would stay again if I get back to Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price for Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: I booked Napa River Inn with some trepidation due to the critical reviews. The main reason for booking there was that it was the most reasonably priced option for us, and we needed 3 rooms for our 40th anniversary trip with our children, their spouses and our 15 month old grandchild. We were in for a pleasant surprise. This was our 4th stay at different hotels in Napa Valley, and Napa River Inn was great. The staff was extraordinary, with each and every one going out of their way to accommodate us. (We took the walking tour of Napa and tour guide said staff is better paid than at most hotels and have all worked there for an extended period.) The rooms were large and lovely. They included all the amenities we wanted, including balcony, magnifying mirror and robes. No problem using air conditioning, or with its location. Breakfast was delicious but I would recommend ordering it to your room, even if you want to eat on the lovely patio. Found Sweetie Pie's staff got overwhelmed and confused, and reluctant to provide food to go, although there were no tables large enough for our group outside the bakery. I would ask for a room on the 2nd floor next time as we did hear noise from above us. No problem with noise from room net door although there was an adjoining door. Location was great. We only went as far north as St. Helena, which took forever on 2 lane highway. We had dinner reservations in Yountville which was a very quick trip as highway is 4 lanes to there.. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location, with lots to offer!”
Reviews.Author: fletchandsus
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in and around San Francisco and Wine Country to wine, dine and mountain bike. We have stayed at the Napa River Inn on several occasions because we really enjoy the location of downtown napa (walk to everything), the extreme comfort of the rooms at the Inn and the number of things offered there. 2 restaurants on site, cute little sweet shop, pastry/coffee shop (from which breakfast will be delivered to your room each morning) and a gift shop with wine tasting. There is also the night club called Silo's which occaisionally has live music and you receive your free winte tasting. We also like the location because there are great mtn biking trails at Skyline Wilderness Park that you can ride to from the hotel. Another perk...they really cater to repeat visitors. We received a discount room rate, room upgrade, and a complimentary bottle of wine upon our arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quaint revitalization of an old mill”
Reviews.Author: Truannsi
Reviews.Content: This is the third time my husband and have stayed here, this time our adult sons accompanied us and loved the place as well. The property was even nicer this time with improvements along the river's edge. The property is very accessible to the local wineries in addition to being located in downtown Napa.
